title: System Architect for Scania Workshop Suite
description:
Scania is now undergoing a transformation from being a supplier of trucks, buses and engines to a supplier of complete and sustainable transport solutions.
**What we do**We at Vehicle Service Information (EYS) are passionate about Uptime and Serviceability. We enable our workshops to be best in class in supporting our customers when they come in for a workshop visit.
Daily, 16,000 Technicians maintain, troubleshoot and repair Scania vehicles and engines worldwide.
To make sure our workshops can deliver world class services, we develop the tool suite SWS, Scania Workshop Suite. It’s a microservice based cloud solution with a web frontend. It’s mainly written in C#, Angular and JS. SWS is hosted in AWS . SWS interacts with Scania’s inhouse developed PDM system and together with our digital twin data provide the information and services the workshops need to excel. The solution also make use of edge computing and vehicle communication hardware developed internally.
**Your Assignment**The development team consists of around 12 cross functional sub teams with a DevOps approach. As a System architect you will be the bridge between the teams and the enterprise and solution architects.
You will be the chairman for the architecture community of practice and make sure that the services developed are possible to maintain and deliver the right performance. As the solution consists of multiple micro services, it’s important that the architecture and standardization make them work together. You act as a coach for the teams when they implement, but also work pre-emptive to make sure our architecture vision and technology align with the business goals.
**Who are you?**We are looking for someone who has great commitment to lead the system architecture development in our solution. You have a vision for the architecture, founded in theory and experience. You work as an informal leader to realize it, and you do that with respect for the individuals involved. You have a positive attitude and find it energizing to engage with many contact points. In your work, you will need extensive cross-functional collaboration where communication skills will be very important.  

  

We believe that you have a master’s degree in computer science and are fluent in both English and Swedish. We also believe that you have several years’ of experience developing cloud based solutions, preferably with an architect role. Experience from the automotive industry and embedded systems is meriting.
**What we offer**A flexible work environment in a hybrid setup where we expect you to be at the office at least 3 days a week. A place to grow, learn and have fun while you do it.
We can also offer other benefits such as free exercise at Scania’s own facility in Södertälje or wellness allowance, performance bonus, occupational pension, flexible working hours, lunch at reduced price, the opportunity for a staff car and much more.
**Further information**Selection will be done continuously
For more information contact Patrik Rönnqvist, Head of Service Solution IT Coordination, +46855383174

**Permanent / Temporary:** Permanent

**Location(s):**Södertälje, SE, 151 38
**Required Travel:** 0-25%
**Workplace:** Hybrid

title: Technical Product Owner
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*  

  

**Job Description**  

Operative/Technical Product Owner (OPO) for the auxiliary control system (XCS).
  

Responsibility to make sure that the backlog for the team is always up-to-date and prioritized.
  

It means also to cooperate with Strategic Product Management, HW design, Project Management, SW teams, and OPOs globally on different sites.
  

There will be a need to describe the value to be delivered to the team and work together to refine the backlog into concrete stories with a clear definition of what should be done.  

  

**Your Profile (Must-have requirements)**  

* Experienced agile Product Owner.
* Embedded knowledge(HW+SW)
* Telecom competence is meriting.
* Good English speaking

  

  

**Application deadline:** 31-01-2025  

  

**About Us**  

We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.  

  

Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?  

  

We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!  

  



**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.


A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.


Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.


Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.


Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?


Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.


Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.


Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Nordisk Presale Cloud Native
description:
*Conoa hjälper företag att modernisera IT-infrastruktur med fokus på Kubernetes, Cloud Native, Container-teknologi, Hybrid Cloud, IaC, CI/CD, Automatisering och DevOps.*

*Linux och Open Source finns i vårt DNA, och vi utvecklas ständigt genom att dela kunskap med varandra. Vi satsar stenhårt på kompetensutveckling genom en generös utbildningsbudget, och våra medarbetare belönas för att hålla sina kunskaper i absolut framkant.*

**Om rollen**


För att ytterligare expandera vår verksamhet söker vi nu en **Presale** med uppdraget att stärka vår förmåga att sälja containerlösningar i Norden: Sverige, Finland, Norge och Danmark.


Huvuduppgiften är att stötta de lokala säljteamen i respektive land genom att driva och stänga affärer med fokus på containerplattformar som tjänst samt erbjuda konsultinsatser, utbildningar och produkter kopplade till området.


Rollen innebär en jämn fördelning av arbetet (25 %) mellan de nordiska länderna och kräver en god förståelse för att navigera och hantera de olika affärskulturerna i regionen.


Du kommer vara de lokala ländernas primära kontakt för Container och Cloud Native frågor men ha fullt stöd av hela Conoas erfarenhet och expertis.


**Dina ansvarsområden**


Målgruppen är medelstora och stora företag samt organisationer, där du kommer att spela en central roll i dialogen med nya kunder och i upphandlingar.


Vi arbetar konsultativt och ofta i en utbildande roll, eftersom Containers fortfarande är ett område med begränsad kunskap hos många kunder. Vår ambition är att bli kundens Trusted Advisor, vilket ställer höga krav på din förmåga att kommunicera, lyssna, och att förstå samt identifiera kundens behov och utmaningar.


I rollen behöver du kunna navigera både tekniska och affärsmässiga diskussioner. Du är skicklig på att presentera på både svenska och engelska, och du trivs i situationer där du förklarar komplexa koncept på ett tydligt och övertygande sätt.


Du kommer att arbeta nära våra kundteam, partners och olika funktioner inom både Conoa och Proact. Tillsammans tar vi fram de bästa möjliga tjänsterna och lösningarna för våra kunder.


Resor i Norden ingår som en del av tjänsten, cirka 20–30 dagar per år.


**Kvalifikationer**

* Du har relevant teknisk kompetens inom Container, Cloud Native, Open Source och IT-infrastruktur.
* Erfarenhet av nätverk, säkerhet och arkitektroller är meriterande.
* Tidigare erfarenhet från arbete i de nordiska länderna är en fördel.
* Du är nyfiken på ny teknik och har ett starkt driv att ständigt utvecklas och lära dig mer.
* Erfarenhet av att hålla presentationer och utbildningar.
* Du talar och skriver flytande svenska och engelska.

**Vad vi erbjuder**


Om du är redo för en spännande utmaning och vill arbeta i ett av Sveriges ledande konsultbolag inom Kubernetes så har vi mycket att erbjuda. Här får du arbeta i teknikens framkant med utmaningar och projekt i moderna IT-miljöer där skalbarhet, säkerhet och automatisering är prioriterat. Du är en del av ett fantastiskt gäng med en varm och familjär kultur.


På Conoa finns ett erfaret team med konsulter, säljare, presale och konsultchefer, som genom moderna arbetssätt och rätt nätverk utvecklas tillsammans. Du kommer att arbeta i uppdrag där du utmanas och får använda din kompetens på bästa sätt.


**Om** **Conoa**

Conoa grundades 2012 med en stark övertygelse om att Linux och Open Source-baserade lösningar är grundbultar i modern infrastruktur. Vårt mål var att bygga ett starkt teknikfokuserat företag med en företagskultur som främjar kompetensutveckling för att ständigt vara relevanta och hjälpa företag in i nya IT-miljöer.


2015 inleddes vår satsning inom Container-teknologi då vi blev första partner i Europa till Docker. Resan fortsatte med viktiga roller i stora kundprojekt, och att vi som första bolag i Sverige utsågs till både Kubernetes Certified Service Provider (KCSP) och Kubernetes Training Partner (KTP). Under dessa år har vi växt fram som en av Sveriges främsta specialister inom Kubernetes, cloud native och container-teknologi.


Vi har förmånen att ha ett 30-tal av Sveriges främsta specialister som medarbetare och vi hjälper några av Sveriges ledande företag att implementera modern Cloud Native infrastruktur.


Sedan april 2021 är vi en del av Proact. Genom samgåendet får vi ännu större möjlighet att utvecklas som specialister, samt att bredda våra tjänster och geografiska närvaro.


**Vi är på en spännande tillväxtresa!** **Vill du vara med?**


**Hör av dig!**


  
Avdelning
IT
Platser
Stockholm
Distansarbete
Hybridarbete

title: Senior Site Reliability Engineer - Cassandra
description:
**Company Description**  

Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose – to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.


Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.

 **Job Description**  

We are seeking an Senior Site Reliability Engineer - Cassandra to Tink - delivering open banking solutions as a part of Visa.


Perhaps the most dramatic outcome of the digital revolution is the amount of data that is now collected and analyzed. Tink handles billions of events, and this number is increasing at an exponential rate. We are passionate about enabling data-driven decisions for our clients and internal stakeholders. Our goal is to ensure data is collected, transformed, and presented securely with accuracy and reliability. Building the infrastructure and services to support this is hence a key part of what Tink engineers are doing.


The Stateful team is the backbone of our data infrastructure and tooling. Playing a vital role in delivering essential database services and developing tools to meet the evolving needs of the Tink organization. We are actively expanding our team, seeking talented Site Reliability Engineers (SREs) and DevOps engineers who can bring their expertise to drive our database services to new heights.


What we offer you:


A position in the Stateful team means working in an international environment where you will be involved in:

* Ensuring scalability and reliability of our most critical operational data store. Primarily Cassandra.
* Collaborating with stakeholders to ensure that the database services and tools align with their evolving requirements and use cases.


This is a hybrid position. Hybrid employees can alternate time between both remote and office. Employees in hybrid roles are expected to work from the office 2-3 set days a week (determined by leadership/site), with a general guidepost of being in the office 50% or more of the time based on business needs.

 **Qualifications**  

We are currently seeking a talented individual to join the Stateful team. Working from our office in Stockholm and help us maintain, expand and evolve our Cassandra database offering


Required qualifications

* Proven experience in managing Cassandra databases at scale.
* A strong desire to foster teamwork and collaborative efforts.
* Working in an IaC environment using tooling such as Terraform, or Ansible
* Experience with monitoring tools like Prometheus, Grafana, Datadog


Nice To Have qualifications:

* Contributing Code to Cassandra or related DB technologies (e.g. Scylladb)
* Familiarity with AWS, RDS, Aurora, DynamoDB, Zookeeper, and Kafka
* Extensive industry experience, including mentoring of junior engineers

  

**Additional Information**  

Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

title: Data Architect konsult till bolag i Stockholm
description:
Teamet för Data & Analytics inom vår kunds IT-avdelning i Sverige arbetar med att bygga ett Data Lakehouse för att möta PwC: s behov av analys. De har definierat både mål- och lösningsarkitekturen och söker nu förstärka teamet för att öka antalet datarör (Data Pipelines) som kan levereras det kommande året.
  
Vi söker en Dataarkitekt med minst 5 års erfarenhet som Data Engineer eller Dataarkitekt. Helst bör du också ha erfarenhet av att implementera en ny Data Lakehouse-lösning. Eftersom en lösningsarkitekt redan finns i teamet och har det övergripande ansvaret för design av den nya dataplattformen, vill vi att Dataarkitekten ska bidra med sin tidigare erfarenhet av att utveckla Data Lakehouse-lösningar. Det inkluderar best practices-dokumentation, lärdomar från tidigare projekt, implementering av Proof of Concepts, med mera.
  
ArbetsuppgifterI din roll kommer du att skapa datamodeller och utveckla Proof of Concepts (PoC) inom följande områden:
  
Dela data (Data Sharing)
  
Datatillgång och åtkomstkontroller
  
Data-lager i ett Data Lake
  
Data Pipelines
  
Dataintegrationer
  
Data-kataloger
  
  

**För att lyckas i rollen bör du ha:**  

Erfarenhet av tekniska roller inom moln- och datamiljöer.
  
Omfattande praktisk erfarenhet av att implementera datadrivna lösningar med Azure och big data-teknologier.
  
Djup kunskap om större big data-lösningar, inklusive Databricks, Synapse Analytics, Azure Event Hub och Delta Lake.
  
Färdigheter i datamodellering, ETL-processer och koncept för Data Lakehouse.
  
Bekantskap med Azure DevOps och verktyg för Infrastructure as Code (IaC), som Terraform.
  
God förståelse för datahantering, säkerhet, efterlevnad och integritetsregler
  
  

Urval sker löpande, vänta inte med din ansökan!

title: Arkitekt Embedded SW C/C++
description:
Vi söker en erfaren och engagerad mjukvaruarkitekt med expertis inom inbyggda system för att driva och utveckla tekniska lösningar i ett tvärfunktionellt team. I denna roll kommer du att arbeta med att implementera funktionalitet i C/C++, samt bidra till systemdesign, felsökning och verifiering av avancerade inbyggda system.
  
Du kommer att samarbeta nära med elektronikingenjörer, testare, applikationsingenjörer och teamledare för att säkerställa att de tekniska lösningarna är skalbara, underhållsvänliga och väl anpassade till verksamhetens strategiska mål. Som en nyckelperson i utvecklingsteamet kommer du även att arbeta tillsammans med plattformsarkitekter för att forma den tekniska riktningen i våra projekt.
  
Förutom det tekniska arbetet förväntas du bidra till förbättringar av våra arbetsprocesser och driva innovation inom utvecklingen av inbyggda system.
  
**Placering:** Huskvarna
  
**Omfattning:** 100 % närvaro på plats krävs.
  
  

**Ansvarsområden:**  

– Utveckling och implementation av funktioner i C/C++ för inbyggda system.
  
– Systemdesign och arkitekturarbete med fokus på skalbarhet och hållbarhet.
  
– Felsökning och verifiering av både hårdvara och mjukvara på kortnivå.
  
– Samverkan med multidisciplinära team för att säkerställa en effektiv integration mellan hårdvara och mjukvara.
  
– Utföra mätningar och analyser med hjälp av mätinstrument för att identifiera och lösa tekniska problem.
  
– Driva förbättringsinitiativ inom arbetsmetoder och utvecklingsprocesser.
  
– Säkerställa att tekniska lösningar uppfyller krav på kvalitet, säkerhet och prestanda.
  
– Delta i tekniska diskussioner och bidra med expertis för att säkerställa robusta lösningar i Linux-baserade system.
  
  

**Kvalifikationer:****För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har:**  

– Relevant akademisk bakgrund, exempelvis civilingenjörsexamen inom data, elektronik eller motsvarande högskoleutbildning.
  
– Minst 8 års erfarenhet av arbete som mjukvaruarkitekt inom inbyggda system.
  
– Gedigna kunskaper i embedded C/C++ och en vilja att fortsätta utvecklas inom området.
  
– Förmåga att arbeta med både hård- och mjukvara, inklusive felsökning på kortnivå med mätinstrument.
  
– Förståelse för mjukvarustyrda hårdvarukrav och systemintegration.
  
– Erfarenhet av Linux och utveckling av programvara för Linuxbaserade system.
  
– Mycket goda kunskaper i både svenska och engelska, i såväl tal som skrift.
  
  

**Meriterande erfarenheter:****Det är en fördel om du har:**  

– Kunskap inom realtidsoperativsystem (RTOS) och deras användning i inbyggda system.
  
– Erfarenhet av att arbeta med versionshanteringssystem såsom GIT och CI/CD-processer med DevOps.
  
– Erfarenhet av utvecklingsverktyg såsom IAR Embedded Workbench eller Eclipse.
  
– Förståelse för och erfarenhet av radiokommunikation och dess implementering i inbyggda system.
  
  

**Personliga egenskaper:****För att trivas och lyckas i denna roll är du:**  

– Teknikintresserad och lösningsorienterad, med en ständig vilja att utvecklas och hålla dig uppdaterad inom området.
  
– En god kommunikatör med pedagogisk förmåga som kan förmedla tekniska lösningar och dela kunskap med kollegor.
  
– Öppen och transparent i ditt arbetssätt, med förmåga att bygga starka relationer och samarbeta effektivt i team.
  
– Engagerad och självgående, med en stark vilja att ta ansvar och driva projekt framåt.
  
– Proaktiv och nyfiken, med en drivkraft att utforska nya teknologier och hitta innovativa lösningar.
  
  

**Vad vi erbjuder:**  

– En möjlighet att arbeta i en tekniskt avancerad miljö med produkter och system som ställer höga krav på säkerhet och kvalitet.
  
– En stimulerande arbetsplats där du får möjlighet att påverka och bidra till tekniska förbättringar och innovationer.
  
– Möjlighet att arbeta i ett kompetent team med hög teknisk expertis.
  
Observera att rollen omfattas av säkerhetskrav, vilket innebär att en säkerhetsprövning kommer att genomföras innan anställning. För att uppfylla säkerhetskraven krävs medborgarskap inom EU/EES eller NATO.
  
Är du redo för nästa steg i din karriär som mjukvaruarkitekt? Välkommen att ansöka!
  
Om Rasulson Consulting
  
Rasulson Consulting är ett specialiserat bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag inom IT-sektorn. Vi samarbetar med ledande tech-bolag och innovativa startupföretag för att erbjuda spännande karriärmöjligheter för dig med intresse för digital utveckling. Genom vår djupa tekniska förståelse och vårt starka nätverk kan vi snabbt matcha rätt kompetenser med rätt uppdrag. Hos oss får du personlig vägledning, regelbunden återkoppling och möjligheten att ta nästa steg i din IT-karriär.

title: SAP Functional Specialist
description:
**Join Our Team VIPAS AB as a SAP Functional Specialist**  

  

  

  

**Do you have what it takes to thrive in the vibrant world of IT consulting? VIPAS AB, a burgeoning company, proudly invites you to embark on your next engaging project as our**

**About VIPAS :**


Imagine a world where your business technology perfectly aligns with your goals—efficient, scalable, and innovative. At VIPAS AB, that’s exactly what we strive to create. As an IT consulting company, we don’t just offer services; we deliver tailored solutions using cutting-edge technologies like Java and Python. Our team is well-versed in software development, DevOps, and engineering, bringing years of experience and expertise. Think of us as your trusted guide, leading your organization through the landscape of modern tech adoption, ensuring every step is taken with confidence and foresight.

**Job Description:**


We are seeking an experienced SAP Functional Specialist for a role based in Stockholm (on-site). The ideal candidate will have expertise in SAP Retail processes, inventory management (MM/SD), and supply chain challenges. They will analyze requirements, write functional specifications, test solutions, and support integrations while maintaining a structured approach using tools like Jira and Active Control.


**Key Responsibilities:**

* Perform **requirement analysis** in collaboration with business experts and other stakeholders.
* Write **Functional Specifications.**
* Conduct **walk-throughs** of requirements and solutions with developers.
* Support developers by providing test data and clarification.
* Conduct **functional testing** to ensure quality.
* Work in a **structured manner** using relevant tools such as Jira, Active Control, etc.
* Conduct **root cause analysis** on problems reported by the markets.
* Maintain a **complex setup** of batch jobs.


**Requirements:**

* Proficiency in **Inventory Management (MM/SD)** within SAP.
* Experience in the **Retail** sector.
* Deep knowledge of the **order-to-cash process** in SAP.
* Understanding of how the **stock count process** integrates end-to-end (E2E) with other store processes, such as:
* Allocation
* Replenishment
* Sales
* BOPIS (Buy Online, Pick up In Store)
* Storage Management
* Familiarity with **supply chain challenges.**
* Expertise in **Article Master Data** in SAP Retail.
* Ability to specify integration contracts and test integrations from a functional perspective.


**Why Join Us?**



Vipas AB offers attractive employment packages for IT consultants, aligned with the Teknikföretagen (Almega) collective agreement. Clients Working with us provides opportunities in diverse industries, allowing you flexibility and growth. If you’re driven and eager to face new challenges, join the VIPAS family.


You'll be part of an innovative team driving the future of telecom, Automotive, Retail, and Banking. If you're ready to take on challenging projects and grow your career in a cutting-edge environment, this is the opportunity for you!


Apply Now & Please feel free to reach me at priyanka@vipas.se & contact me at +46727749222


Note: Please do apply if you have Sweden PR/ citizenship OR a Sweden work permit.

 **How to Apply:**


Interested candidates are encouraged to apply by submitting their resume and cover letter. Join us in driving innovation in the VIPAS AB!

 **Please note! We offer continuously. That means that we sometimes remove the assignments before the deadline. If you are interested we recommend that you apply immediately.**

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
**DevOps Engineer** 




 Vill du var med i vår resa där vi älskar teknik och satsar på våra medarbetare. Just nu växer vi och vi behöver bli fler och söker efter en till tre nya medarbetare. Vi erbjuder en trygg, rolig och utvecklande arbetsmiljö med kunder i världsklass. Här får du möjlighet till utbildningar, konferenser, resor och bonusar.
 



 Dynamist är ett ägarlett konsultbolag med det intressanta målet att skapa effektiva och säkra IT-lösningar åt sina kunder. Det uppnås genom hög grad av automatisering samt att nyttja teknologier som ligger i framkant, och dessutom genom vår långa och mångsida erfarenhet inom utveckling, systemintegration och förvaltning. Stor vikt läggs på din personliga utveckling och hela bolaget bidrar till en kreativ och utmanande miljö.
   





**Kompetenskrav** 



* Utveckla integrationslösningar och verktyg i främst Python, Bash eller Powershell
* Erfarenhet av att använda testbaserad utveckling, och testautomatisering
* Erfarenhet av versionhantering med Git
* Undersöka identifierade defekter, utföra djup felsökning och sammanställa resultat
* Erfarenhet av Docker containers
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av komplexa systemlösningar, varav Linux minst 2 år



  





**Övrigt meriterande** 



* Orkestrering med Kubernetes eller liknande
* Ha förståelse för och anammat begrepp som GitOps, Phoenix Server och Infrastructure as Code
* Erfarenhet av agilt arbete
* Konfigurationshantering med Ansible, SaltStack, Puppet eller Fabric
* Hantering av resurser i molntjänster med Terraform, CloudFormation eller liknande
* Erfarenhet av kompilering och bygg- och utvecklingsmiljöer såsom Open Build Service (openSUSE)
* RPM- och DEB-paketering



  





 Dynamist är ett företag som drivs av passion och leds av vår ambition. För att bygga rätt lagkänsla erbjuder vi tekniska forum eller som vi kallar det Superhero, Dynameet och Hackathon. Som en i vårt lag erbjuds du personlig utveckling genom externa konferenser, utbildningar, och bonus vid certifieringar.
 



 Personliga egenskaper är att du är nyfiken, känsla för detaljer och uppskattar en trivsam miljö med rätt utmaningar och kollegor.
 



  





**Omfattning och tillträde** 




 Heltid med omgående tillträde.
 



  





**Om arbetsplatsen** 




 Vårt kontor ligger i centrala Stockholm där de flesta av våra kunder finns . Men söker även efter kollegor i Enköping, Västerås och Eskilstuna.
 



  





**Välkommen med din ansökan!** 




 Vi undanber oss kontakt med annonsörer och bemanningsföretag i rekryteringen.

title: DevOps Engineer - Infrastructure and Automation
description:
We build a platform for controlling & monitoring self-driving vehicles
   

  

 Scania is currently undergoing an exciting transformation from a traditional truck manufacturer to a provider of complete sustainable transport solutions. Autonomous Transport is a crucial part of this transformation as Scania’s success depends on flexible and efficient solutions that support current and future business requirements.
   

  

 Intelligent Transport Systems is a section at Scania Research & Development. We are contributing to Autonomous Transport Solutions by providing cloud-based systems (AWS) for automated, optimized, and safe vehicle control and monitoring, all built into one platform.
   

  

 We need a Platform & DevOps Engineer
   

  

 Our Development Platform team is growing. Help us build the infrastructure that powers our off-board software (technology outside of the actual vehicle). In this role, you'll be instrumental in building and managing cloud-based systems for our autonomous vehicle platform using AWS.
   

  

 Your mission
   

  

  

* Design, develop, and deploy scalable and reliable applications using Kubernetes, AWS, Cilium, GitLab CI/CD, Crossplane, IAM, and Infrastructure as Code (IaC).
* Collaborate with various teams to ensure successful technology implementation and integration.
* Participate in all phases of software development, from conception to maintenance.
* Troubleshoot and resolve complex technical issues, focusing on performance and reliability.


 Who you are
   

  

 As a person you’re a team player, you like to share your knowledge and expertise. You are self-managing, curious, dare to try, and are motivated by changes.
   

  

 You need to have a sense of order, analytical ability, and be safety conscious.
   

  

 You enjoy working in a team, have good collaboration skills, and work constantly to improve and optimize how and what we do. You also have a deep interest in platform technology, software development, automation, and DevSecOps.
   

  

 You'll need
   

  

  

* Proficiency in Kubernetes, AWS, CI/CD, and IaC.
* Degree in Computer Science or related field preferred.
* Merit if you have experience working with Keycloak and other IAM solutions


 It is beneficial if you are familiar with our tech stack: Terraform, Terragrunt, IAM, Karpenter, Crossplane, DynamoDB, Grafana, Tempo, Loki, Prometheus, OpenTelemetry, ArgoCD, GitLab pipelines, Python, Bash, Go, Apache Kafka, Cilium, Redis.
   

  

 Who am I as your manager?
   

  

 I am here to support our team in being successful, and happy, and working on the things that are most important to help our customers, improve our product, and improve our business. I am also here to engage, retain, and grow world-class talents (That is you!). I have a curious mind and like to know why we do the things we do.
   

  

 I value Trust, Transparency, Collaboration, and Courage. If you are curious about me I encourage you to check my LinkedIn profile.
   

  

 Our offer
   

  

 We offer a healthy and inspiring workplace, with respect for the individual, where you have great opportunities to shape your work and your future. Your personal and professional development is important and something we encourage and support.
   

  

 We believe in modern leadership thinking and an agile way of working, and we think you will fit perfectly into that mindset. We work from home and at the office in Södertälje, So with some planning, you will find a good work/life balance.
   

  

 Looking forward to hearing from you, feel free to reach out to me if you have any questions.
   

  

 Your future manager,
   

  

 Göran Henrixon, Head of Platform, +46-8-553 70758
   

  

 Application
   

  

 If you are interested and feel that you have a fair share of what is mentioned above, please apply!
   

  

 Selections and interviews will take place on an ongoing basis throughout the application period. Please apply no later than 2025-02-04.
   

  

 Your application should include a CV and degree certificate. Instead of a cover letter, please answer the questions stated when you submit your application. A background check might be conducted for this position.

title: DevOps Engineer with Kafka and Event-Driven Architecture Expertise
description:
**Job Description**
 If taking H&M’s integration platform to its next level excites you, then this opportunity is for you! The Event and Integration Services team is looking for an experienced DevOps engineer with a strong focus on working with Kafka. In this role, you will engage with a diverse and innovative integration ecosystem, collaborating with a highly skilled team that maintains various central integration platforms at H&M. You will see the big picture, identify patterns, and instinctively know how to win support for your ideas. Partnering with different teams and areas, you will support our Unit in driving the Integration Platforms & Services mission and roadmap. You will build and configure Kafka solutions that are easy to maintain and adapt, regardless of tools or languages. Believing in a non-hierarchical culture of collaboration, transparency, safety, and trust, you will work with a focus on value creation, growth, and serving customers with full ownership and accountability. Join our high-performance team and constantly improve the experience of our end users.
   

  

**Key responsibilities:**
* Strong experience in software engineering with focus on event streaming platforms such as Kafka and Solace.
* Worked with Event-driven Architecture and knowledge of how to implement this on a large scale in an Enterprise.
* Deep understanding of CI/CD automation for platform onboarding and self-service capabilities
* Deep knowledge of public cloud technologies (Azure & GCP primary)
* Strong agile mindset and skilled in planning, prioritizing, execution, and follow ups with cross functional teams.
* Develop and maintain event-driven architecture using platforms like Solace and Kafka.
* Ensure high quality of developed technical solutions
* Evaluate new platforms and features and work on proof of concepts and prototypes
* Deliver on time, demonstrating a strong commitment to deliver on the team mission and agreed backlog
* Create knowledge and produce the necessary documentation


**Qualifications**
* 10+ years of overall experience with 5+ years of experience working as a DevOps Engineer
* Deep understanding of Event-Driven Architecture principles.
* Substantial experience with version control software (Azure DevOps, Github etc.)
* Extensive hands-on experience with event platforms such as Solace and Kafka.
* Strong scripting skills (Powershell, Bash, or similar).
* Proficiency in scripting and automation using tools such as Terraform, Ansible, or similar.
* Extensive experience with the Microsoft Azure platform especially working with Azure storage, Event grid.
* Experience with a sprint-based agile way of working and knowledge of tools like Jira, confluence, ServiceNow
* Knowledge and experience working with performance testing methodologies and tools


**Additional Information**
 This is a
 **fulltime permanent position** 
 , starting as soon as possible according to agreement. The role is an on-site position, based in our office in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

 Apply by sending in your
 **CV in English** 
 as soon as possible, but no later than the
 **31st of January** 
 . Due to data policies, we only accept applications through career page.
   

  

**Benefits**
 We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  

 In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.
   

  

**Inclusion & Diversity**
 H&M is a part of H&M Group. At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organisation. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.
   

  

 We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.
   

  

**Company Description**
 H&M is a fashion brand that offers the latest styles and inspiration, from fashion pieces and unique designer collaborations to affordable wardrobe essentials. Our business idea is fashion & quality at the best price in a sustainable way. Learn more about H&M here.

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
*Är du redo för ett nästa steg i karriär och vill vara med där det händer, på en plats där dina ambitioner möter banbrytande teknologi? Upptäck en värld av möjligheter hos Mycronic!* 




  





**Om företaget** 




 Mycronic är erkänd som en global pionjär inom leveransen av högprecisions produktionsutrustning och är känd för att tillsammans med sina kunder ständigt förflytta teknikens gränser. Genom att erbjuda stöd som håller elektronik- och displaytillverkare i framkanten av konkurrensen, säkerställer de att dessa aktörer förblir effektiva och relevanta i det långa loppet. Branschledare inom ytmonteringsteknologi (SMT), halvledarindustrin och fordonssektorn litar på Mycronics innovativa produkter, tjänster och lösningar för att utforma framtidens elektronik, allt från sofistikerade skärmar till livräddande medicinska implantat och nästa generations satelliter.
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 Som DevOps-infrastrukturingenjör kommer du att ha en mångsidig och tvärfunktionell roll. Denna innefattar att bygga upp infrastrukturer och fungera som en avancerad användare för en mängd infrastrukturverktyg. Bland dessa verktyg ingår GitLab, Artifactory, Kubernetes, Docker, VMware, Cloud Azure och Black Duck
 



  





 Du kommer att vara experten på de verktyg som stödjer mjukvarans livscykel från utveckling till distribution. Programmeringskunskap är viktig för att kunna arbeta med verktygen samt kunskap om hur man arbetar med underhåll med minimala driftstörningar samt utveckling av nya verktyg och skript för att automatisera ditt dagliga arbete.
 



  





**Vi söker dig som har:** 



* BSc eller MSc inom datavetenskap, programvaruteknik eller motsvarande erfarenhet inom området
* 2-5 års arbetserfarenhet inom relevant område
* Engelska och svenska i tal och skrift
* Stark grundläggande kunskap i Python-programmering
* Erfarenhet av skriptning såsom Bash eller Powershell
* Grundläggande kunskap i programvarutestningsramverk
* Erfarenhet av att testa och utvärdera nya verktyg och metoder för effektiv IT-utveckling



  





**Personliga egenskaper** 



* Kommunikativ
* Affärsmannamässig
* Självgående
* Strukturerad
* Teknisk intresserad



  





**Övrigt** 




 Start: Enligt överenskommelse
 



 Placeringsort: Täby
 



 Omfattning: Heltid och upp till 2 dagar remote
 



  





 Anställningsform: Detta uppdrag är ett konsultuppdrag som sträcker sig över 6 månader, med möjligheter till förlängning eller överrekrytering.

title: Data Architect
description:
Hello Network!
 



  





  





 I hope you're doing well today,
 



  





  





 We are looking for a
 **Data Architect** 
 for a freelance project in Stockholm, SE:
 



  





  





**Start-end + option: After contract writing – 2 years + option: 1+1 years.** 




**Station location: Stockholm, some possibility of remote work.** 




**Languages: Swedish & English Speaking** 




**Pay Rate: Negotiable** 




**Scope: 100%** 




  





  





**Consultant shall commit to being subject to security clearance under the Security Protection Act.** 




  





  





**Context:** 




  





  




* The authority needs to modernize the platform for data and analysis. Today there is the analysis platform on premises, but the customer sees that in the future they need to be able to put parts of the platform in the cloud. They are looking for a data architect who can support us in this work. The work includes everything from data modeling at a detailed level as well as the development of architecture proposals at a higher level. The work takes place in close collaboration with the platform teams, the data teams and other IT teams.
* In order to succeed in the assignment, an understanding of the different amounts of information the customer handles and how the information is best consumed in the business is needed. Deep technical knowledge is also needed about on premises solutions based on container technology as well as hybrid solutions for data management and analysis. The role includes a large amount of communication and requires drive and commitment. Knowledge is also required in implementing a proposed architecture.



  





  





**Requirements:** 




  





  




* Competence level 5 (10+ year).
* Shall have experience working to develop architecture for modern data management and analysis solutions (AI/ML) in hybrid environments.
* Should have knowledge and experience in setting requirements for modern data management solutions.
* Shall have experience in implementing and building modern data management solutions.
* Shall have experience in and have worked with Python and R development as well as platforms for this.
* Shall have experience with Kubernetes and container technology linked to data and analysis as well as AI/ML.
* Shall have the understanding and experience to ensure IT security within data management architecture and development.
* Should have worked with database modeling and information modeling for data warehouses.
* Should have worked with ETL/ELT tools for at least three years.
* Should have been working on business intelligence solutions for at least five years.
* Shall have at least three years of experience with Microsoft SQL Server.
* Should have been working on Kimball modeling in data marts for at least three years.
* Should have experience and have worked with CI/CD principles and DevOps in data warehouse development.
* Should have worked with data governance and data catalogs.
* Should have worked with SQL in relational databases for data warehouses.



  





  





**Should Requirements:** 




  





  




* Should have experience with open source products in data and analytics.
* Should have experience with OpenMetadata.
* Should have experience in developing strategies and guidelines in data management.
* Should have experience working with GDPR assurance of data warehouse solutions.
* Should have experience in automation of data pipelines and warehouse development.
* Should have experience in data vault modeling.
* Should have experience in agile work and /or the SAFE framework.
* Should have experience working with data lakes.
* Should have experience of working with database solutions linked to machine learning models.
* Should have experience working on performance optimization for datawarehouse solutions.
* Should have experience with SAS datawarehouse solution.
* Should have experience with DevOps in ETL development and data management.
* Should have experience working in the financial/insurance industries.
* Should have experience in assignments in banking and the financial sector.



  





  





 If interested in this role, please apply on this job post or contact @Michael Whitbread with your CV?
 



  





  





 Good luck with your possible application!

title: Senior Data Engineer
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Engineering Services, and Manufacturing
description:
**Profile/Role:** 
 Data Engineer
 



  





**Job Description** 




  





 We are now looking for a Senior Data Engineer who is passionate about building analytical solutions on SAP Data. You will help the company to derive the most of our data assets - with ultimate accountability for the business and customer value it delivers.
 



 As a senior Data Engineer in the SAP Analytics Platform product, you will be working with one of the larger and volume intense SAP BW installations in the world. You interact with a high number of stakeholders to ensure the best utilization of our SAP BW investment. As a senior Data engineer, you are good at coaching others – like leading programming sessions, presenting and aligning solutions to complex problems, and having a wide perspective on engineering practices to build scalable and robust platforms.
 



 You will deploy different Analytical features, on SAP BW, and on other SAP OLTP systems as well. But not only this, but you will also use several products from Microsoft, Google, and other tools in order to fulfill the Analytical need of your Stakeholders.
 



 As a Senior Data Engineer, you have great leadership skills believe in a non-hierarchical culture of collaboration, transparency, safety, and trust.
 



 Working closely with the Product Area leadership and other Engineers to ensure overall alignment & key results. We believe you have a strong agile and DevOps mindset with Scrum Master experience so that you can drive Agile development practices.
 



 This dual role offers a unique opportunity to combine SAP BW skills with a passion for Agile methodologies and team collaboration.
 



  





**Qualifications** 



* A Data engineer with a minimum of 10 years experience in SAP BW development
* Experience in at least 3 full life cycle implementations on SAP BW or BW/4HANA with HANA modelling
* A person having previous extensive experience from SAP BW Retail scenarios, including experience from the following Data Sources:
* - General Ledger, Billing (SAP ECC)
* - Inventory Management (SAP ECC)
* - POS-data (SAP CAR)
* - Warehouse transactions (SAP EWM)
* Experience with frontend analytics using SAP Analytics Cloud, PowerBI.
* Experience with Datasphere
* Experience with CDS Views based data modeling, Data integration, and provisioning to-and-from SAP BW.
* Experience in Data Volume Management. Preferable project experience with large data volume
* Experience in Integrated Planning/BPC
* A great team player in an Agile team setup, willing to take different kinds of tasks to meet sprint commitment and to reach our goal together.
* Facilitating the events required by Scrum and ensuring that the team is actively driving development.
* Help everyone in the team, or interacting with the team, to understand Scrum theory, practices, rules and values (teaches, coaches, facilitates).



  





**We are also looking for you who have** 



* Have several years of experience as a Data Engineer with strong abilities in modern engineering practices
* Advanced knowledge in SAP data analytics
* Scrum master experience
* Have competence within different agile frameworks and supporting tools
* Great collaboration and communication skills, both English and Swedish is a plus

 Co-Workertech.com
 




**Join our LinkedIn groups for updates on upcoming opportunities! Connect, collaborate, and thrive with industry leaders :** 



* Co-Worker Technology
* Co-Worker Renewable Energy Industry Jobs



**Follow us to stay updated on the latest news, insights, and exciting announcements from our company.** 




  





 👉
 
 Facebook
 




 👉
 
 Instagram
 




  





**Let's stay connected and grow together! 🚀**

title: Serverless Fullstack Engineer, Solna
company_industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
description:
At PostNord Group IT, we build the best digital customer solutions for the Nordic markets. Some examples are PostNord Customer Portal, Skicka Direkt, PostNord app and the Postcards app. Live tracking, parcel robots and digital postage are some of the latest services we have developed.
   

  

 With us, you are met by an open and warm work environment, here we are constantly working to learn and improve. Sharing and learning by mistake is an important part of our culture.
   

  

 We work agile in a DevOps culture. The teams are the backbone of our organization and are self-governing, which means great opportunities to influence technology choices and working methods.
   

  

 The team seeking your knowledge is the Pay to PostNord Team!
   

  

**The team**
 We, the Pay to PostNord Team, is responsible for PostNord Group´s digital payment solutions. These solutions are central to our growth. As a full-time developer with us you will be part of an agile team that has cutting-edge expertise in the area of payment solutions. We handle on average over 20 million transactions every year from satisfied customers from all over the Nordics.
   

  

 We are responsible for the payment solutions in their entirety - new development, product lifecycle management, solution architecture, monitoring and operation (DevOps). The ambition is to constantly be at the forefront of technology and together we help build innovative payment solutions for digital products within PostNord.
   

  

 Developers part of this team have the option to take lead on specific projects and act as a representative for the Pay to PostNord Team. The support of the team and the tech lead will always be very close if needed. This has been very appreciated by the team members.
   

  

**Some of our technologies/techniques**
* Microservices/Serverless
* Typescript/Javascript
* NodeJS
* AWS - Lambda, DynamoDB, SQS, S3 to name a few.
* REST
* React/Angular/Vue
* CSS
* Grafana


 ,
   

  

 We believe that you enjoy working in an agile environment where you get great opportunities to be involved and influence the work and the technical choices. You should also love to learn about new technologies/solutions and get acquainted with new contexts since this is part of our everyday life in the Pay to PostNord Team.
   

  

 As a person, you are committed, responsible and unpretentious. We believe that you have several years of experience as a developer and preferably experience of payment solutions, solution architecture and database development.
   

  

**Your profile**
* Backend development in NodeJS (Javascript or Typescript).
* AWS or similar cloud platforms (Azure, OpenStack or Google Cloud).
* Knowledge in at least one modern frontend framework (Angular, React or Vue).
* Academic education in computer science or equivalent experience.
* English or Swedish in speech and writing.


**We offer you**
* To work with our modern tech stack and you are given great opportunities to influence the choice of technology.
* We aim to have a great work-life balance and we have the support of our own System Operations Team that handles any incident outside of the developers working hours.
* We encourage you to develop. For example, we sponsor you to AWS certify.
* A job where the value you deliver is important to hundreds of thousands of users.
* Flexible hybrid workplace with an open working climate.
* Good insurance and occupational pension conditions.
* Wellness allowance and access to office gym and swimming pool.
* Employee benefits through PostNord's own employee foundation PostNord Plus.
* Employment according to a collective agreement.


**We make everyday life easier**
 PostNord is the leading supplier of communication and logistics solutions to, from, and within the Nordic region. We ensure the provision of a postal service to households and businesses in Sweden and Denmark. We aim to make everyday life easier and more sustainable for everyone who lives and works in the Nordic region. We are accountable, brave and committed, effectively leading change regardless if we lead our self or others. We emphasize teamwork, sincerity and positive relationships in the workplace. We build on our success and learn from both colleagues and mistakes. People with different backgrounds work with us. You will therefore be part of a workplace with great diversity, which contributes to better results for the business. Visit us at www.postnord.com.
   

  

**Apply**
 What are you waiting for? Welcome with your application. Selection is ongoing, so apply as soon as possible. If you have any questions about the position please send an email to petra.wahlund@postnord.com Note that we do not accept applications via email. We look forward to hearing from you.

title: Tech Lead for Production Core unit with great Java skills, Solna
company_industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
description:

* Experience with relational Database like Oracle or Postgres and non-relational like
* Understanding of container orchestration platforms and experience deploying production software

**We believe you are a person that is**

**We offer you**
**Benefits**
 We offer a variety of work in an international environment with constantly new challenges and quick decisions. Here you have opportunities to develop creative solutions and work in a prestige-free group where we jointly help to reach our goals. PostNord is one of Sweden's largest workplaces and we offer safe employment conditions and benefits. In addition to the benefits mentioned above, we offer:
   

  

* Hybrid workplace with a Nordic and dynamic environment. Watch the video about our office.
* Great development opportunities
* Great insurance and occupational pension terms
* Wellness allowance & opportunity to train at Arken's gym and indoor swimming pool
* Employee benefits through PostNord Plus - PostNord´s own personnel foundation


**We make everyday life easier**
 PostNord is the leading supplier of communication and logistics solutions to, from, and within the Nordic region. We ensure the provision of a postal service to households and businesses in Sweden and Denmark. We aim to make everyday life easier and more sustainable for everyone who lives and works in the Nordic region. We are in a constant transformation and work consistently to develop both our offer and our employees, all to achieve our vision of being The favorite carrier of the Nordics. We are PostNord - a fantastic company to work and grow with. Read more at postnord.com
   

  

**Apply**
 We look forward to receive your application!
   

  

 If you have any questions or concerns, please contact manager Carolina Lunde on carolina.lunde@postnord.com. Don't wait to submit your application as we go through the applications on an ongoing basis.
   

  

 For union representatives, visit: Facklig kontakt | PostNord

title: SAP Functional Specialist
description:
**🚀 Join Our Team VIPAS AB as a SAP Functional Specialist 🚀
   

  

 Do you have what it takes to thrive in the vibrant world of IT consulting? VIPAS AB, a burgeoning company, proudly invites you to embark on your next engaging project as our**
**About VIPAS**
 Imagine a world where your business technology perfectly aligns with your goals—efficient, scalable, and innovative. At VIPAS AB, that’s exactly what we strive to create. As an IT consulting company, we don’t just offer services; we deliver tailored solutions using cutting-edge technologies like Java and Python. Our team is well-versed in software development, DevOps, and engineering, bringing years of experience and expertise. Think of us as your trusted guide, leading your organization through the landscape of modern tech adoption, ensuring every step is taken with confidence and foresight.
   

  

**Job Description**
 We are seeking an experienced SAP Functional Specialist for a role based in Stockholm (on-site). The ideal candidate will have expertise in SAP Retail processes, inventory management (MM/SD), and supply chain challenges. They will analyze requirements, write functional specifications, test solutions, and support integrations while maintaining a structured approach using tools like Jira and Active Control.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Perform requirement analysis in collaboration with business experts and other stakeholders.
* Write Functional Specifications.
* Conduct walk-throughs of requirements and solutions with developers.
* Support developers by providing test data and clarification.
* Conduct functional testing to ensure quality.
* Work in a structured manner using relevant tools such as Jira, Active Control, etc.
* Conduct root cause analysis on problems reported by the markets.
* Maintain a complex setup of batch jobs.


**Requirements**
* Proficiency in Inventory Management (MM/SD) within SAP.
* Experience in the Retail sector.
* Deep knowledge of the order-to-cash process in SAP.
* Understanding of how the stock count process integrates end-to-end (E2E) with other store processes, such as:

title: Penetration Tester to Operational Security Center \u007C SEB Stockholm
description:
Join Our Purple Team in Stockholm!  

  

Are you a passionate penetration tester looking for exciting challenges beyond traditional compliance testing? Join SEB’s established Purple Team and play a pivotal role in advancing our cyber resilience. This is your chance to dive into engaging, self-selected penetration testing projects alongside a team of skilled professionals.  

About the Role  

At OSC, we’ve built a dynamic Purple Team that bridges the gap between offensive and defensive security. As a Penetration Tester in this team, you will:* Conduct advanced and high-impact penetration tests on systems, applications, and infrastructure, focusing on projects chosen by the team for their complexity and impact.
* Collaborate with security engineers and incident responders to enhance detection and response capabilities.
* Design and execute targeted red team exercises, simulating real-world adversary scenarios.
* Perform scenario-based security assessments to proactively identify and mitigate gaps in security.
* Situational awareness, stay ahead of emerging threats, continually innovating and sharpening your skills.

  

You’ll be part of our Operational Security Center, working closely with Security Engineers, Incident Responders, and Vulnerability Managers. Together, we push the boundaries of what’s possible in operational security and purple teaming. If you’re ready to take your penetration testing career to the next level, we’d love to hear from you!  

Note: Traditional compliance-driven testing is managed by external consultants—your work will focus on the most challenging and stimulating aspects of penetration testing.  

About You  

  

We’re looking for a skilled and motivated penetration tester with:* Several years of experience conducting advanced penetration tests in diverse environments, including Windows, Linux, and cloud platforms.
* A deep interest in offensive security, with a strong desire to tackle unique and challenging security projects.
* A collaborative mindset, thriving in team environments and sharing knowledge.
* Broad technical skills, with programming, application security, or infrastructure security experience being a plus.
* Relevant certifications such as OSCP, OSEP, or similar (preferred but not required).

 **Other meriting skills:**
C2 frameworks, implementation and disruption of cyber kill chains, building pentest/purple teaming infrastructure, EDR evasion techniques, etc. **Do you want to be part of SEB?**It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.  

Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today via the link in this ad, but no later than 2025-02-07. If you have questions about the position, please contact hiring manager Torbjörn Askenberg at:torbjorn.askenberg@seb.se, but please note that we will not be able to process applications via email.

Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes for example identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and criminal records checks. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks. **Learn more about working at SEB** on our Career website or through our Career podcasts.
https://sebgroup.com/career
https://bit.ly/SEBcareer

title: Data Mesh Governance Specialist
description:
**We are looking for a data governance specialist with experience in implementing governance practices in data and analytics functions. You will join a team of specialists with great passion for data governance and data management. Together as a team, we will work on building capabilities for federated data governance, aiming for computational governance that will enable governance by design. Your role in the team will be to focus on establishing data governance capabilities, guardrails, and guidelines for our analytics data platform on Google, where cross-competent teams are building data products. This will not only require technical capabilities for data governance on Google Cloud Platform, but also training efforts and education on how to adhere to our data governance policies, both towards technical resources building data products, but also analysts on the business side who use data and sometimes create new data products in their daily work.**


### **Responsibilities**


* Act as subject matter expert for data governance topics in data and analytics.
* Work together with the Data Governance team to roll out governance capabilities for company’s most critical data assets.
* Define principles, guardrails and guidelines together with the product teams to secure that solutions are aligned with the architectural principles of Data Mesh.
* Serve as a link between business and tech to ensure that the management of data is in line with current and future business requirements of the company.
* Implement data governance roles and responsibilities to ensure clear accountability for the most critical data assets.

  


**Technical Skills**


* Experience in driving data governance topics in data and analytics.
* Experience from working in data mesh architecture.
* Experience from writing guidelines and guardrails.
* Experience from large and global organizations.
* Used to working with both technical and business questions.
* Excellent verbal communication and documentation capacity in English.
* It is beneficial if you have previous experience from project management and agile way of working.

title: Information Security Specialist
description:
**Job ID:** R0010408


**Date posted:** 21/01/2025


Are you an information security specialist with the capability to both lead and perform operational support in a global context? Are you passionate about securing and protecting information and digital products and platforms against known and emerging threats? Do you have a knack for spotting trends and finding creative solutions to complex problems and want to have fun at work? If so, then come join our team at IKEA!

**About the role**


As Information Security Specialist, you support our digital product and platform teams to manage their information security risks. This involves having regular interactions with teams that work on various digital business-enablers, including digital products that are used by IKEA customers worldwide. You support these teams to identify and mitigate their information security risks, and ultimately actively contribute to protecting trust in the IKEA brand.

**More specifically, in this role you will**

* Lead assessments to support digital product and platform teams to identify and mitigate their information security risks, such as business impact analyses, digital risk assessments, third party assessments and AI assessments.
* Advise digital product and platform teams to implement information security controls. You leverage our digital risk control framework, but you are also capable of thinking out-of-the-box and recommend tailored solutions and work side-by-side with the teams to find practical solutions.
* Develop cyber security training content and facilitate trainings for product and platform teams.
* Document our engagement with digital product and platform teams to support digital risk management and reporting.
* Support our processes to ensure that Inter IKEA Group adheres to internal and external (regulatory) requirements and standards (e.g., NIS2, CRA, CER, AI Act, 27001, OWASP).
* Act as an ambassador of IKEA values, promoting collaboration, innovation, and a positive work culture.

**You will work together with but not limited to**

* The team’s information security and data privacy leaders to ensure digital risks are managed on the appropriate level and are escalated if needed.
* Our centralized information security and data privacy capability teams to ensure the digital product and platforms teams that you support leverage available capabilities, such as identity and access management, security monitoring, and disaster recovery.
* The network of information security and data privacy teams across Inter IKEA Group to standardize and further improve our ways of working.
* Other IKEA companies across the globe.


This role is positioned within the Information Security and Data Privacy Business Enablement team in Operations Management, part of Inter IKEA Group’s Enabling Functions and reports to the Information Security and Data Privacy Business Enablement team manager. Occasional traveling, mainly to Sweden/Netherlands, will be required to stay connected with Inter IKEA Group’s network of information security and data privacy teams and the digital product and platform teams you support.

**About you**


We do some amazing things at IKEA, therefore we need some amazing people – this position is not an exception! You should be able to inspire and mobilize people toward clear objectives, embrace ambiguity, and contribute to building new capabilities. You are curious and able to build relationships to establish strong trust between the information security and data privacy community and its stakeholders. It is also necessary that you carry natural credibility, and you have a proven track record of reaching stretch targets.

**We expect you to**

* Have 5+ years of relevant knowledge, and hands-on experiences in information security and IT risk management.
* Have hands-on experience with modern and emerging technologies, such as the major cloud platforms and artificial intelligence.
* Have experiences navigating in complex global organizations and adaptable in a highly dynamic organization setting.
* Experience in advising, consulting and guiding business and IT stakeholders on how to handle data securely across its lifecycle from creation and storage to use and disposal.
* Knowledge of secure coding practices and data protection techniques
* Be a natural facilitator and excellent communicator who can engage and motivate stakeholders.
* Have a pragmatic approach towards problem-solving.
* Be comfortable with agile methodologies and have experience in a product-oriented organization.
* Have excellent command of the English language with the ability to cater to non-native audiences.


The IKEA culture and values are very much a part of our business and day-to-day work life. For you to thrive and grow with IKEA it’s important for us that you share our values! You can read more regarding our values and life at IKEA at www.IKEA.com. At IKEA, we are looking for people who believe everyone deserves a seat at the table. You’re welcome no matter where you come from, what you believe, and what you look like. We don’t even care how you have furnished your home. We’re interested in you simply because you’re you. Even if your experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. We believe that people’s different perspectives, backgrounds, and personalities make us better at understanding our customers’ dreams and needs. At IKEA, we’re all on the same project.


If you have a special need that requires accommodation in the recruitment process, just let us know.

 **More Information**  

If you have any questions about the role, please reach out to Evisa Kica evisa.kica@inter.IKEA.com – Inter IKEA Group Information Security & Data Privacy Manager. You might have some questions about the recruitment process, and we are more than happy to answer those! Feel free to connect with our recruiter Sarah Arshad sarah.arshad@inter.IKEA.com Interested? Submit your CV, in English, by 4th February 2025. We look forward to receiving your application!
company_description: At IKEA, we share an inspiring vision: “to create a better everyday life for the many people”.

description:

Their dedication and expertise elevate every project we undertake together. title: Mid-Market Cloud Advisor
description:

title: Senior Platform Engineer
description:
Fortum are seeking an experienced Senior Platform Engineer with a strong focus on Microsoft 365 (M365) and Identity and Access Management (IAM) to join our CloudOps & Platform Engineering team.  

  

In this position you can be based in our offices in Solna, Espoo or Wroclaw.

  


**About the role**

  


In this role, you will be part of the M365 & IAM technical squad, responsible for administering and optimizing our M365 Platform and IAM solutions, developing and maintaining PowerShell scripts, and managing infrastructure automation. You will collaborate closely with various teams to ensure the high availability and security of our hybrid environment.

  


In your role, your responsibility is to implement, manage, and support M365 platform and services at a technical level. In more detail, the following is part of your responsibilities:


* Administer and optimize the Windows Server ecosystem, hybrid AD infrastructure and other IAM solutions.
* Develop and maintain PowerShell scripts for automation and configuration management.
* Implement and manage infrastructure automation (Infrastructure as Code) and configuration management.
* Monitor, implement, and support live distributed production systems.
* Ensure high availability and clustering technologies are in place.
* Address security implications and challenges created by public cloud deployments, especially Azure.
* Resolve escalated cases from the service desk and other engineers.
* Communicate effectively in English, both written and spoken.

  


**About You**


* Hands-on technical experience in the administration of Windows Server ecosystems.
* Proficiency in PowerShell scripting language.
* Experience with Entra and/or Azure (AWS or OCI is a plus).
* Experience with infrastructure automation (Infrastructure as Code) and configuration management.
* Proven experience in working on live distributed production systems (monitoring, implementation, and support).
* Working knowledge of networking - DNS, Load Balancing, Firewalls, Routing, Web.
* Experience in designing and implementing IAM/PAM solutions.
* Knowledge of high availability/clustering technologies.
* Excellent English communication skills (both written and spoken).

  


**We offer you**  

At Fortum, we believe in a better future and want to be involved in shaping it. Our workplace is a safe place, both physically and mentally. You will grow with professional colleagues, being trusted and free to challenge yourself. We offer comprehensive benefits, flexible working hours, and hybrid work model to support your productivity, development and wellbeing. We are committed to build diverse teams where everyone feels included and is treated equally.

  

  

More information about our culture and benefits can be found here.

  


**Interested?**  

Submit your application latest on 4th of February via our online recruitment tool. We start contacting suitable candidates already during the application period. If you have questions and would like to hear more about the position, please contact Petri Miettinen, Director, CloudOps and Platform Engineering by email petri.miettinen@fortum.com.  



Contact details to union representatives for Sweden can be found on the bottom of this page.  



To be selected for the position, the applicant must go through background clearance and a health examination including drug testing.

  

  

**We are Fortum**  

Fortum is a Nordic energy company. Our purpose is to power a world where people, businesses and nature thrive together. We are one of the cleanest energy producers in Europe and our actions are guided by our ambitious environmental targets. We generate and deliver clean energy reliably and help industries to decarbonise their processes and grow. Our core operations in the Nordics comprise of efficient, CO2-free power generation as well as reliable supply of electricity and district heat to private and business customers. For our ~5 000 employees, we commit to be a safe, and inspiring workplace. Fortum's share is listed on Nasdaq Helsinki. fortum.com

title: Cyber Security Analyst
description:
**Let's introduce ourselves**
-----------------------------

  

The Cyber Defence Centre team’s responsibility is to guide, advise and protect Volvo Cars and its customers by designing and embedding security in everything we do using future proof, automated and data driven solutions, ensuring we stay on the safe side.  

  

Furthermore, advanced analytics will facilitate and guide business functions e.g. by enabling self-service capabilities and providing personalized real-time data insights. This will ensure a more proactive approach to detecting and responding to cybersecurity threats and incidents. Our teams consist of experts in all areas of cybersecurity - Cyber Defence Centre 24/7 Operations, and cybersecurity enablement including an academy, advisory, and data management.


**What you'll do**
------------------

  

Would you like to be a leader in a growing organization and support the advancement of cybersecurity at Volvo Cars? Do you want to be a part of our transformation and our mission to enable the organisation to act correctly around cyber risks? Then this might be the right opportunity for you!  

  

The Cyber Defence Centre team’s responsibility is to guide, advise and protect Volvo Cars' and its customers by designing and embedding security in everything we do using future proof, automated and data driven solutions, ensuring we stay on the safe side.  

  

Furthermore, advanced analytics will facilitate and guide business functions e.g. by enabling self-service capabilities and providing personalized real-time data insights. This will ensure a more proactive approach to detecting and responding to cybersecurity threats and incidents. Our teams consist of experts in all areas of cybersecurity - Cyber Defence Centre 24/7 Operations, and cybersecurity enablement including an academy, advisory, and data management.  

  

In this role, your primary responsibilities will be to oversee and enhance security monitoring, detection, and response capabilities to ensure the protection of the company’s digital assets. Besides this, you will:  

  

* Research the newest developments and advancements in the field of Cybersecurity to stay in the forefront when it comes to procedures and technology used for security operations and response.


  

* Ensure the continuous improvement of security tooling, technologies, and processes.
* Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to assess security risks and provide actionable recommendations.


  

* Collaborate closely with security leaders and cross-functional teams to manage risk, strengthen security posture, and drive remediation efforts while continuously tactical priorities.


  

* Oversee the development and maintenance of documentation, policies, procedures, and response.

**What you'll bring**
---------------------

  

We are seeking a Security Operations Technical Lead. This is a senior-level position, overseeing Volvo Cars Security Operations Center (SOC) and engineering activities. We believe that you have a solid background in SOC processes and best practices, along with technical expertise and a strong passion for operational excellence.  

  

You shall have similar previous experience and skills such as:  

  

- Certified with CISM, CISSP or equivalent, accompanied by practical experience in the field.  

  

- Strong operational background in cybersecurity, with expertise in SIEM platforms, threat intelligence, SOAR, cloud technologies, digital forensics, and incident response procedures.  

  

* Familiar with data-driven and software development practices.


  

* Advanced analytical and problem-solving abilities, capable of identifying and addressing complex challenges effectively.


  

If you are passionate about cybersecurity, enjoy having fun at work, and have a track record of success in managing and leading diverse/distributed teams, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity!  

  

This is a full-time position in Gothenburg, Lindholmen office. We have a hybrid setting where we expect you to be in the office a couple of days a week.
**Sounds interesting? Welcome your application!**
-------------------------------------------------

  

We’d love to receive and review your application. We welcome you to apply in English as soon as possible, however no later than 16th of February 2025. Please apply through the provided link. Once you receive a confirmation email from the system, your application will be acknowledged.


**Volvo Cars - Driving change together**
----------------------------------------

  

Volvo Cars’ success is the result of a collaborative, diverse, and inclusive working environment. Today, we are one of the most well-known and respected car brands, with around 43,000 employees across the globe. At Volvo Cars, your career is designed around your skills and aspirations, allowing you to reach your fullest potential.  

  

By 2025, we aim to sell 1.2 million cars annually, with 50 per cent being electric cars and sold directly to customers mainly through digital channels. Join us on this exciting journey as we pioneer the driving and electrification technologies of the future.
