------------------

  

Would you like to be a leader in a growing organization and support the advancement of cybersecurity at Volvo Cars? Do you want to be a part of our transformation and our mission to enable the organisation to act correctly around cyber risks? Then this might be the right opportunity for you!  

  

In this role, your primary responsibilities will be to oversee and manage the operations and management of Volvo Cars Security Operations Center. Besides this, you will:  

  

* Lead and manage day-to-day the 24/7 operations of dedicated distributed teams located onshore, nearshore, and offshore and ensure effective incident response.
* Supervise a team of analysts, engineers and change managers.
* Create, monitor, and analyse operational performance metrics, leveraging business intelligence capabilities to generate actionable insights and reports for stakeholders.
* Build and manage long-term relationships with internal business units, suppliers, and partners to foster ongoing maturity in cybersecurity posture, structure, and culture.
* Oversee the development and maintenance of documentation, policies, procedures, and response.

**What you'll bring**
---------------------

  

We are seeking a Security Operations Lead. This is a senior-level position, overseeing Volvo Cars Security Operations Center (SOC) and engineering activities. We believe that you have a solid background in SOC processes and best practices, along with technical expertise and a strong passion for operational excellence.  

  

You shall have similar previous experience and skills such as:  

  

* Certified with CISM, CISSP or equivalent, accompanied by practical experience in the field.
* Strong operational background in cybersecurity, with expertise in SIEM platforms, threat intelligence, SOAR, cloud technologies, digital forensics, and incident response procedures.
* Effectively communicating security issues, risks, and solutions to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Advanced analytical and problem-solving abilities, capable of identifying and addressing complex challenges effectively.
* Distributing tasks effectively, ensuring the right resources are allocated to address security issues promptly.
  

  

If you are passionate about cybersecurity, enjoy having fun at work, and have a track record of success in managing and leading diverse/distributed teams, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity!  

  

This is a full-time position in Gothenburg, Lindholmen office. We have a hybrid setting where we expect you to be in the office a couple of days a week.


**Sounds interesting? Welcome your application!**
-------------------------------------------------

  

We’d love to receive and review your application. We welcome you to apply in English as soon as possible, however no later than 16th of February 2025. Please apply through the provided link. Once you receive a confirmation email from the system, your application will be acknowledged.


**Volvo Cars - Driving change together**
----------------------------------------

  

Volvo Cars’ success is the result of a collaborative, diverse, and inclusive working environment. Today, we are one of the most well-known and respected car brands, with around 43,000 employees across the globe. At Volvo Cars, your career is designed around your skills and aspirations, allowing you to reach your fullest potential.  

  

By 2025, we aim to sell 1.2 million cars annually, with 50 per cent being electric cars and sold directly to customers mainly through digital channels. Join us on this exciting journey as we pioneer the driving and electrification technologies of the future.
company_description: At Volvo Car Group, our vision is clear: "To be the world's most progressive and desired premium car brand".

title: Drifttekniker (Server, nät, cloud, support)
description:
### **START**


 2025-02-03

### **SLUT**


 2025-06-30

### **STAD / REMOTE**


 Stockholm

### **OMFATTNING**


100%

### **UPPDRAGSBESKRIVNING**


System- och Nätverksteknikern ansvarar för att designa, implementera och underhålla organisationens IT-infrastruktur för att säkerställa dess optimala prestanda, säkerhet och tillförlitlighet. Rollen kräver en djup förståelse för nätverksteknologier, systemadministration och problemlösningsförmåga.  

  

**Nätverksinfrastruktur**  

  

Designa, implementera och underhålla nätverksinfrastruktur, inklusive routrar, switchar och brandväggar.  

Konfigurera nätverksinställningar och protokoll (t.ex. TCP/IP, VLAN, DHCP).  

Övervaka nätverksprestanda och felsöka nätverksproblem.  

  

**Systemadministration**  

  

Installera, konfigurera och underhålla servrar, arbetsstationer och annan IT-utrustning.  

Hantera användarkonton och behörigheter.  

Felsöka systemrelaterade problem och lösa dessa snabbt.  

  

**Teknisk support**  

  

Ge teknisk support till användare och lösa systemrelaterade problem.  

Assistera vid distribution och underhåll av programvaror.  

  

**Integration**  

  

Integrera olika system och applikationer inom organisationens IT-miljö.  

Utveckla och underhålla API:er och integrationsramverk.  

  

**Säkerhet**  

  

Implementera och underhålla säkerhetsåtgärder för att skydda organisationens IT-infrastruktur och data.  

Hantera säkerhetsincidenter och implementera korrigerande åtgärder.  

  

**Kontinuitet i verksamheten**  

  

Utveckla och underhålla planer för katastrofåterställning.  

Säkerställa data-säkerhetskopior och systemredundans.  

Minimera driftstopp vid systemfel eller uppgraderingar.  

  

**Kostnadseffektivitet**  

  

Optimera IT-resurser för att minska onödiga kostnader.  

Implementera effektiva system för att förbättra produktivitet.  

Förhindra kostsamma driftstopp och dataförlust.  

  

**Skalbarhet och tillväxt**  

  

Planera och implementera IT-infrastruktur för att stödja verksamhetens expansion.  

Säkerställa att systemen kan hantera ökade arbetsbelastningar och användarkrav.  

  

**Prestandaoptimering**  

  

Övervaka och finjustera system för att uppnå topprestanda.  

Identifiera och åtgärda flaskhalsar i IT-infrastrukturen.  

  

**Strategisk planering**  

  

Anpassa IT-infrastrukturen till verksamhetens mål och strategier.  

Tillhandahålla teknisk expertis för beslutsfattande kring IT-investeringar.

  

### **KOMPETENSKRAV**


Kandidatexamen i datavetenskap, informationsteknik eller ett närliggande område.  

Minst 3 års erfarenhet av system- och nätverksingenjörsarbete.  

Gedigen förståelse för nätverksteknologier (t.ex. TCP/IP, routing, switching).  

Kunskap om server- och arbetsstationsoperativsystem (t.ex. Windows, Linux).  

Bekantskap med virtualiseringsteknologier (t.ex. VMware, Hyper-V).  

Erfarenhet av verktyg för nätverksövervakning och felsökning.  

Utmärkta problemlösnings- och felsökningsförmågor.  

Stark kommunikations- och samarbetsförmåga.  

### **MERITERANDE**


Certifiering inom nätverksteknik (t.ex. CCNA, CCNP).  

Erfarenhet av molntjänster (t.ex. AWS, Azure, GCP).  

Kunskap om skriptspråk (t.ex. Python, PowerShell).  

Erfarenhet av säkerhetsverktyg och koncept: brandväggar, intrångsdetekteringssystem, kryptering, åtkomstkontroll.

title: Project Manager
description:
**Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you’d like, where you’ll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you’ll be able to reimagine what’s possible. Join us and help the world’s leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, more inclusive world.**

**THE ROLE**  

**Within Capgemini, the Cloud Infrastructure Services business provides leading solutions to large global customers. The unit focuses on integrating and connecting resources to increase the speed, agility and cost efficiency of our clients’ transformation initiatives. We are a global team of professionals who help organizations meet their business goals by transforming and managing their IT infrastructure landscape – leveraging innovations.**

**We are now looking to strengthen our team with an experienced Senior Technical Project Manager! This position will be located in Malmö or Copenhagen, but you will be a part of a Nordic team. For this role Swedish or Danish language skills are mandatory.**

**As Technical Project Manager, You will take responsibility for leading a range of projects within Capgemini’s Cloud Infrastructure Services. Our Project Managers work in close co-operation with large business clients managing various projects from the beginning to the end. This means you will manage the client relationship, set realistic expectations within agreed cost and time scales, and ensure customer satisfaction. In practice, You will contribute actively in assisting with pre-sales, manage project teams and monitor progress using best practices and appropriate quality standards.**

**YOUR PROFILE**  

**Qualifications:**

* **Proven track record in IT project management especially in the infra, cloud and/or cyber field**
* **Deepened understanding of relevant technologies and architectures**
* **Several years of experience in delivering customized projects for high demand end-users**
* **Solemn project planning methods and budgeting skills**
* **Know-how of activities related to infrastructure installation and configurations**
* **Ability to work with various third parties and service providers**
* **Excellent communication and prioritization skills**
* **Swedish/Danish and English fluent language skills**

**WHAT YOU’LL LOVE ABOUT WORKING HERE**

* **A challenging career in a vibrant environment with access to extensive training and a global network of experts**
* **Opportunities to work on real-world problems and help transform leading organizations**
* **A company culture driven by core values: Honesty, Trust, Freedom, Team Spirit, Modesty, Fun, and Boldness**
* **A strong commitment to inclusion, diversity, and supporting the whole person**
* **An innovative culture that promotes learning, growth, and shared success**

**#LI-JF1**

**Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fuelled by its market leading capabilities in AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of €22.5 billion.**
company_description: Capgemini is a global leader in partnering with companies to transform and manage their business by harnessing the power of technology.

title: Business Analyst
description:
**Job Description**  

Are you ready to take your next step within H&M Group and do you want to make a difference within Logistics Controlling & Analytics? Do you have a passion for solving complex technical problems and learn quickly? Are you a team player ready to join a diverse Analytics team that will accelerate your own experience? The Global Logistics Controlling & Analytics team within H&M is now looking for a Business Analyst to take on this exciting challenge. Are you the one?


 The Business Analyst team is part of the Controlling & Analytics department in Logistics, which is supporting all Brands and business models within H&M Group. The team is diversified with colleagues with different backgrounds working closely together to improve the business. As a team member you will also work in close cooperation with many departments within H&M – both globally and regionally.


Key Responsibilities


As a Business Analyst you will be working as the logistics functions backbone of the company with solving complex technical problems and have an end-to-end view. This is an opportunity to get onboard on a transformation journey at the world’s leading fashion retailers and where you drive transparency in demand driving supply chain. You will be a part of a team of controllers and analysts where you will be a leading part in a specific competence area. Our ideal candidate is self-going and has an interest and drive in data analytics.


Your main responsibilities will be to:

* Collaboration with Logistics Program in Business Tech to drive the data migration from Microsoft Azure to Google Cloud Platform
* Together with the project manager, align Logistics priorities and take part of PI planning, follow up progress throughout the PI.
* Work closely with business stakeholders and specify requirements in a structured way to ensure the data foundation.
* Support and coordinate acceptance testing.
* Build Power BI reports and data models that take H&M’s analytical capabilities to the next level.
* Perform comprehensive analysis to support ad-hoc reporting requests.
* Project manage cross functional & cross regional report development projects.
* Identify, initiate, and drive various data quality investigations and improvements, including daily monitoring.
* Ensure that security is set up according to logistics needs and legal requirements.
* Close collaboration with BT to rollout changes requirements on Legacy data platform
* Represent Logistics in the H&M Analytics forums encouraging the development of the analytics competence within Logistics function and collaboration with analysts in other functions.

  

**Qualifications**  

To be successful in this role we see that you have:

* At least 2 years of experience within roles as Business/Data analyst or similar roles
* A higher education within business administration, engineering, or statistics
* Strong drive or interest in analytics
* Experience/knowledge in SQL.
* Strong analytical skills and the ability to comprehend high level data architecture.
* Ability to communicate complex and large amounts of data through effective visualizations and dashboarding in Power BI
* A background in Retail and/or Supply Chain is considered as a plus.
* Strong communication and project management skills
* Advanced knowledge in Microsoft Excel,
* Fluent written and spoken English.

  

As a person we believe that you are an open minded, flexible and a communicative team player full of drive and optimism. You believe in collaboration and thrive in a constantly changing environment. You are curious by nature and triggered by the challenge of a complex problem. You have a self-going personality with a strong sense of responsibility and have a genuine interest in creating business value out of data. You are actively following the latest developments in BI tech and have the drive and knowledge to realize its potential.

 **Additional Information**  

This is a **parental leave cover** position starting as soon as possible and will be based, preferably, in Stockholm or close by a logistics facility within Europe with willingness to travel to Stockholm.


Locations of H&M Logistics’ main facilities in EU: Stockholm/Eskilstuna or Gothenburg/Boras (SE), Hamburg (DE), Poznan, Warsaw (PL), Brussels/Ghlin (BE), Copenhagen (DK), Madrid (ES), London/Birmingham/Milton Keynes (GB), Piacenza/Stradella (IT), Eindhoven/Tilburg (NL), Vienna (AT).


If you feel that your experience, skills, and ambitions are right for this role, please send your CV in English by latest **03 February 2025** the assessment process will start immediately so please apply as soon as possible!

**WHO WE ARE**


H&M Group is a family of brands; H&M, COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories and ARKET. At H&M Group, our people are the driving force behind our commitment to creating meaningful growth and more sustainable lifestyles. Help us re-imagine fashion and together we will re-shape our industry. Learn more about H&M Group here.

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**  

  

At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.

* 25% Staff discount on all our H&M Group brands, both in stores and online (H&M, COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories and ARKET).
* H&M Incentive Program – HIP. Learn more about the program here.

**JOIN US**


Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.  



Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.  



**We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.**

title: Mid-Market Cloud Advisor
description:
**Company Description**  

Devoteam is a leading technology partner to Google Cloud, AWS, and Microsoft across EMEA. With 20+ years of successful Google Cloud implementations and a team of certified experts, we drive digital transformation across various industries.


At Devoteam, we champion a revolutionary "New Way of Work" that prioritises flexibility, personal growth, and joint success.

 **Job Description**  

Drive Digital Transformation: Become a Mid-Market Cloud Advisor

* As a Cloud Advisor for Google Cloud and other cloud technologies at Devoteam, you will play a crucial role in expanding our footprint across the Nordics and DACH. You will be responsible for:
* Hunting for New Business: Identify and acquire new customers with a focus on medium-sized businesses, generating leads and building strong relationships with key decision-makers.
* Driving Revenue Growth: Develop and execute sales strategies to achieve ambitious targets, exceeding customer expectations and contributing to Devoteam's continued success with hyperscalers and ISVs.
* Mastering the Sales Cycle: Own the entire sales process, from initial contact and needs analysis to proposal development, negotiation, and closing deals.
* Building Long-Term Partnerships: Cultivate strong relationships with existing clients, identifying opportunities to expand our services and ensure their ongoing success in all areas of their technology procurement.


Staying Ahead of the Curve: Maintain a deep understanding of the evolving Cloud ecosystem, including new products, services, and market trends.  



Success Stories:  

*"Joining Devoteam in the Nordics has been a transformative experience. The support from the local tech teams and the clear growth path have enabled me to consistently exceed my sales targets."*  

*— Aliha Mahmood, Junior Sales, Sweden*

*"Transitioning from Google to Devoteam has been a remarkable experience. The collaborative culture and unwavering commitment to innovation at Devoteam have empowered me to utilize my Google Cloud expertise to its fullest potential. Working with cutting-edge Google Cloud solutions here has significantly advanced my career and allowed me to deliver exceptional value to our clients."*  

*— Thomas Brunn, Sales Executive, Norway*


Territory

* You'll be working with startups and mid-market corporations across the Nordic or the DACH region, primarily digital natives.

  

**Qualifications*** Proven Hunter: Demonstrated success in acquiring new customers and closing deals in the IT project business, with a focus on hyperscaler technologies.
* Solution-Oriented Mindset: Ability to understand client challenges and translate them into effective Cloud solutions.
* Strong Communication & Presentation Skills: Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively articulate the value proposition of Cloud to C-level executives.
* Relationship Builder: A natural networker who can build rapport and establish trust with clients and internal stakeholders.
* Results-Driven: Highly motivated and results-oriented, with a strong work ethic and a commitment to exceeding expectations.
* Languages: Excellent written and spoken English skills are essential. Fluency in a Nordic language is a plus. In DACH fluent German is a requirement.

 **Additional Information**  

Devoteam is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace where everyone feels valued and respected. We encourage applications from individuals with diverse backgrounds and experiences.  

  

Benefits:

* Flexible Work Arrangements: Enjoy a hybrid work model with the freedom to choose your working hours and location.
* Career Development: Access to the Devoteam Academy for certified training and language courses, supporting your professional growth.
* International Opportunities: Explore potential career opportunities within our global network.
* Vibrant Culture: Be part of a dynamic and supportive team with regular social events and team-building activities.
company_description: Devoteam is a leading consulting firm focused on digital strategy, tech platforms, cybersecurity and business transformation.

title: Senior Security Architect
description:
**Company Description**  

IFS is a billion-dollar revenue company with 6000+ employees on all continents. Our leading AI technology is the backbone of our award-winning enterprise software solutions, enabling our customers to be their best when it really matters–at the Moment of Service™. Our commitment to internal AI adoption has allowed us to stay at the forefront of technological advancements, ensuring our colleagues can unlock their creativity and productivity, and our solutions are always cutting-edge.


At IFS, we’re flexible, we’re innovative, and we’re focused not only on how we can engage with our customers but on how we can make a real change and have a worldwide impact. We help solve some of society’s greatest challenges, fostering a better future through our agility, collaboration, and trust.


We celebrate diversity and understand our responsibility to reflect the diverse world we work in. We are committed to promoting an inclusive workforce that fully represents the many different cultures, backgrounds, and viewpoints of our customers, our partners, and our communities. As a truly international company serving people from around the globe, we realize that our success is tantamount to the respect we have for those different points of view.


By joining our team, you will have the opportunity to be part of a **global, diverse environment;** you will be joining a **winning team** with a **commitment to sustainability;** and a company where we get things done so that you can **make a positive impact** on the world.


We’re looking for innovative and original thinkers to work in an environment where you can **#MakeYourMoment** so that we can help others make theirs. With the power of our AI-driven solutions, we empower our team to change the status quo and make a real difference.


If you want to change the status quo, we’ll help you make your moment. Join Team Purple. Join IFS.

 **Job Description**  

A Senior Security Architect at IFS works with high-level architecture and design, for software and infrastructure included in IFS products. This work is focused on interpreting and analyzing functional and technical requirements to ensure Security by design is embedded in IFS software solutions. Security, Privacy and Compliance are key aspects of this work. A Senior Security Architect works in collaboration with others to ensure secure architectural design.


A Senior Security Architect at IFS learns and applies successful strategies, implements secure patterns and improvements to engineering methodologies and practices across the product portfolio. A Senior Security Architect actively engages with peers and team members to drive the spread of Security best practices and knowledge throughout the IFS community.


In addition, a Senior Security Architect at IFS continuously expands their Architecture, Security, Privacy and Compliance domain knowledge, which includes keeping up to date on industry trends.  

Senior Security Architects at IFS will be few but are respected advisors to their Team lead, VP, SVP, CTO, or Directors of Software Engineering when it comes to being able to drive secure technical projects across teams and groups. They bring their knowledge and experience to bear and ensure a secure successful technical outcome whilst being aware of our heritage and only adopting new technologies when there is a need and in such a secure way of interoperation with our heritage technologies. At times individuals in these roles will be representing the whole company in key projects and as trusted advisors when it comes to evaluating potential acquisition targets.


As a Senior Security Architect, you are expected to:

* Provide technical leadership for secure design and development of software & infrastructure meeting functional & non-functional requirements.
* Use threat modeling to assess risks and attack the surface of IFS Products.
* Identify Security controls to address IFS Product threats.
* Advise on the implementation of Security patterns.
* Advise on best Security practices.
* Perform Security architecture reviews of IFS Products.
* Ensure Security, Privacy, and Compliance in software & infrastructure components developed using well-established Security/architectural principles.
* Prepare design documentation, reports, and technical presentations.
* Contribute to improvements in Security, Privacy, and Compliance of IFS products & services.

  

**Qualifications**  

* A degree in Cyber Security, Software Engineering, Computer Science, or Information Technology.
* 7+ years of experience with a track record in working with Enterprise Grade Applications.
* Ability to envision the big picture and work on details.
* Have strong secure software & infrastructure architectural, technical design and programming skills.
* Sound Security knowledge in C#, Java, JEE technologies, iOS, Android, REST APIs, Azure, K8s and containerization.
* Sound OWASP Top 10 knowledge (Web, Mobile, K8s).
* Sound knowledge of Security standards (e.g., NIST, ISO 27001, CIS).
* Experience with risk assessment methodologies (e.g., ISO 27001).
* Experience in Azure and cloud services Security.
* A natural desire to discover and learn new technologies and processes.
* Excellent communication (verbal and written) and multi-tasking skills along with an innovative mindset.
* CSSLP certification.
* Azure Security certification (AZ-500: Microsoft Azure Security Technologies).
* Desired: CISPP, CISA, CRISC, OSSINT knowledge, software development background, TOGAF.

  

**Additional Information** *We embrace flexibility and hybrid work opportunities to support diverse needs and lifestyles, while also valuing inclusive workplace experiences. By fostering a sense of community, we drive innovation, strengthen connections, and nurture belonging. Our commitment ensures you can work in a way that suits you best, while also engaging with colleagues to share ideas and build meaningful relationships.*
company_description: IFS develops and delivers cloud enterprise software for companies around the world who manufacture and distribute goods, build and maintain assets, and manage service-focused operations.

title: Senior ML Engineer
description:
**Company Description**  

We're an award-winning Google Cloud partner. We're the experts in transforming businesses and shaping the future of cloud technology. Join us and collaborate with top minds, build groundbreaking solutions, and make a real difference for our clients. Enjoy extensive professional development, global reach, and a supportive, Google-inspired culture. If you're passionate about the cloud, this is where you want to be.


With over 13 years of experience in Google Cloud under our belt, offices in 18 countries and more than 600 experts, we have deployed practical innovation alongside Google. We focus on infrastructure modernisation, data management, smart analytics, application modernisation, and AI & machine learning.


Curious about our projects? We got you: Check out our success stories

 **Job Description** **Day-to-day life**

* Design, develop, and deploy cutting-edge machine learning models – crafting bespoke AI solutions for our Nordic clients.
* Collaborate with data scientists, data engineers, and Google experts to overcome complex challenges and deliver impactful outcomes.
* Champion knowledge sharing and mentorship, guiding junior colleagues in the art of machine learning and fostering a culture of continuous learning.
* Stay at the forefront of Google Cloud AI/ML technologies, continuously expanding your expertise and exploring new possibilities.
* Confidently present solutions to clients, bridging the gap between complex algorithms and real-world business value, while actively cultivating and expanding those customer relationships.


Want to know more?Check out our people stories on Youtube

 **Qualifications**  

We're seeking a passionate and experienced ML Engineer with a proven track record in designing, developing, and deploying machine learning models. You'll be a cloud enthusiast with a deep understanding of AI/ML principles and hands-on experience with cloud technologies. As a coding expert, you'll possess strong Python skills and a solid foundation in machine learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, LangChain, LangGraph).

  

Excellent communication is essential – you'll build strong relationships with clients, translate their needs into innovative AI solutions, and present complex topics with clarity and confidence. You're a true collaborator, thriving in team environments where knowledge sharing and mutual support are paramount.  

Fluency in both **Swedish** and **English** is required.

 **Additional Information** **Why Choose Devoteam G Cloud?**

* Own the AI revolution: Dive into the exciting world of Generative AI and ML, playing a pivotal role in shaping projects around Google's groundbreaking Gemini foundation model.
* Innovative Impact: Work on the forefront of cloud technology at a globally recognized leader in Google Cloud solutions.
* Direct Google Connection: Collaborate closely with Google teams, shaping the future of cloud and AI.
* Unleash Your Expertise: Thrive in a fast-paced environment where sharing knowledge and success is paramount.
* End-to-End Impact: Drive complete business transformations, from strategy to implementation and beyond.
* Accelerate Your Career: Grow within a Google-inspired culture, gaining specialisations and certifications.

*"Partnering with Devoteam has been a highlight of our efforts at Google Cloud. Their dedication and expertise elevate every project we undertake together. It's truly a collaboration that delivers exceptional results." — Alexander Percivall, Senior Partner Engineer, Google Cloud Nordics, Stockholm, Sweden.*


We do plenty of activities, like meet-ups, hackathons, and partnerships. Don’t lose any of them: follow us on LinkedIn

**Benefits**

* Encouragement and support for training and certification, in the form of coaching from other team members, cost coverage, and financial incentives.
* Challenging and rewarding assignments, many of which are end-to-end.
* A hybrid work model as standard, with flexible working hours and location to support your work-life balance.
* An international, diverse, and inclusive team.
* A human-centric and value-based company culture.
* Wellness grants for sports activities (5,000 SEK/year).
* A modern office in central Stockholm.
* Full provision of work tools.
* A variety of social events.


Our culture is based on continuous learning and career development, supported by a genuine, inclusive, and expert team that really loves pizza.  

  

Want to know more about life at Devoteam? Check our Instagram page


Ready to join an elite team? Apply for our Senior ML Engineer position and become part of something exceptional!


Is this not the right position for you? Don’t worry, we have plenty of opportunities! Check out our Career page

title: Senior ASIC verification Engineer
description:
Senior ASIC verification Engineer


Swedium Global is the growing System Engineering and Solution Company, offers services like Semiconductor Engineering R&D Services, Embedded Systems Development, Custom Application Software Development, Web and Cloud Application Development, Testing Services, Consultancy and Outsourcing services to our clients across the globe for an onsite and offshore business model. Swedium Global is having presence in Sweden, Finland, Poland, Czech Republic and in India.


Location: Sweden


Expected Start date: ASAP


Job Name: Senior ASIC Verification Engineer


The work as SoC level verifier is about participate in top-level verification of cutting-edge Multi-chip ASICs that power complex, high-performance systems. Our designs hold several hundreds of processor cores, DSPs as well as ARM cores, and many high-speed interfaces, including Ethernet, CPRI, and PCIe.  

  

Work:  

- Participate in development of software driven tests written in C.  

- Debug failing test cases using the SystemC/TLM platform, in RTL simulation or the hardware emulator, depending on available platform, type of failure and type of test.  

- Potentially integrate UVM VIPs, and develop related sequences. Note only required for a minority of our tests.  

- Contribute to keeping your tests clean in the CI regression running on our four run platforms.  

- Potentially, compilation and partitioning of designs to run in the hardware emulator.


You can reach out to us at Pratik.pandey@swediumglobal.com or hr@swediumglobal.com


  
Job Overview


* Location : Kista, Sweden
* Vacancy : 1
* Key Skills : SOC. C based SOC, ASIC Verifiction, UVM, C based SOC

title: Senior ASIC Verification Engineer
description:
Senior ASIC Verification Engineer


Swedium Global is the growing System Engineering and Solution Company, offers services like Semiconductor Engineering R&D Services, Embedded Systems Development, Custom Application Software Development, Web and Cloud Application Development, Testing Services, Consultancy and Outsourcing services to our clients across the globe for an onsite and offshore business model. Swedium Global is having presence in Sweden, Finland, Poland, Czech Republic and in India.


Location: Sweden


Expected Start date: ASAP


Job Name: Senior ASIC Verification Engineer


 We are looking for an experienced verification engineer to lead innovation in the ever-evolving world of telecommunications.  

As a member of our ASIC IP team, the candidate will be instrumental in shaping the 5G and 6G waves. Experience and insight will play a pivotal role in ensuring the delivery of high-quality IPs that shape the future of global connectivity. Expertise will be critical in turning game-changing ideas into real-world solutions that will shape the future of connectivity while being part of a culture that thrives on creativity, collaboration, and making a real-world impact.  



What the candidate will do:  

- Develop a comprehensive verification planning, including specifications.  

- Architect and enhance state-of-the-art verification environments.  

- Implement and maintain UVCs, ensuring every corner of the design is verified.  

- Drive both random and directed testing strategies to uncover hidden bugs.  

- Leverage advanced coverage techniques to ensure top-tier verification completeness.  

- Champion continuous improvement in product quality, efficiency, and workflows.  

  

Skills to bring  

- Expertise in ASIC or FPGA verification at IP, sub-system, and chip levels, using SystemVerilog UVM. Possibly 15 years of experience in Verification.  

- Hands On experience designing UVM test environments and driving coverage closure  

- An insatiable curiosity, ready to learn something new daily and apply it to make a real difference.  

- Creative problem-solving skills?you see challenges as opportunities for innovation.  

- A collaborative spirit and the ability to thrive independently, with exceptional communication skills.  

- A results-oriented mindset with a passion for continuous improvement, always seeking more innovative, faster solutions.  

- A Master?s degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or a related field.


You can reach out to us at Pratik.pandey@swediumglobal.com or hr@swediumglobal.com


  
Job Overview


* Location : Kista, Sweden
* Vacancy : 1
* Key Skills : SV, UVM, ASIC Verification, IP

title: Systems Engineer - LEOP
description:
###### **Solna/Kiruna**


**At SSC, we provide our customers access to Space. With over 700 employees around the world, we provide expert-level competence in customer support including the design, test, launch, in-orbit and routine operations of flight and space systems. To achieve this, SSC uses our global network of ground systems and multi-mission antennas to provide satellite management, data downlink, antenna hosting and launch support to some of the largest names in the space industry including NASA, ESA, JAXA and many other New Space customers as well.**

  


**YOUR ROLE**



We offer an opportunity to be part of the LEOP (Launch and early orbit) team, a global team that has the end-to-end responsibility of setting up SSC systems as well as execute the critical operations to our customers, providing a link from the ground to the customers satellites. As a Systems Engineer, your role is to perform multi-domain technical leadership, coordination, configuration, testing, documentation, and support. This is executed in the form of participation in projects, analyses/technical investigations as operational support, as well as support interactions with customers.



The work includes international travels to customers and other SSC facilities. As this position is critical to the operations of the SSC Services it may include out of hours working and/or being part of an on-call team with up to 1 week on-call per month.


**Examples of work tasks:**

* Systems Engineer in service establishments, lead integration of new space missions into the SSC telemetry, tracking and control (TT&C) system.
* Perform critical operations and early handover phase to operations for non-critical support, as well as support incident management for routine operations.
* Interaction with customers on technical matters, document decisions, track changes and follow up on actions and overall deliverables on your projects during the integration process.
* Planning, executing and reporting testing both internally and with customer to enable a successful integration.
* Interaction with technology suppliers and vendors on technical matters.
* Providing coordination and reporting, internally and externally with customer to enable the technical implementation, on time and budget.

  


**WHO YOU ARE**



To thrive in this role, you have a drive to provide excellence in technical solutions as well as a drive to learn new things. You like technical challenges, collaboration, and teamwork in an international environment. You have some years of experience of working with systems, preferably both hardware and software, and likely excited by the growing space industry. You are able to describe your designs and ideas to customers and colleagues with the ability to communicate complex technical solutions in an easy, understandable . As required in the Space business, you are able to write technical documentation and follow formal processes.


**We also believe you have:**

* Bachelor or Master degree or corresponding experience in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or Space Technology and a general interest in all three areas.
* Experience in Systems Engineering hardware/software design, integration, test or critical support.
* You are comfortable communicating in English, both written and spoken.


 **It is a merit if you have:**


* Comprehensive understanding of the theoretical aspects of the “Space-to-Ground” communications, and Software architecture.
* Experience of the Space-to-Ground Segment domain.
* Experience of Project Management, perform project planning, reporting and risk management.
* Familiarity with ground station/network equipment and protocols in satellite communication (RF modulation techniques, error coding, and standards).
* Good proficiency in Swedish.

  


**WE OFFER YOU**


* A unique chance to work with a variety of Space projects in an area that is in rapid development and innovation with the inclusion of new technologies such as Software Defined Radio and cloud technologies.
* An excellent opportunity for personal and career development.
* An international workplace characterized by an open atmosphere and proud employees all over the world.
* A global mindset and a global team of talented engineers who work with important services helping Earth benefit from Space.

  


**LOCATION**



This is a permanent position with 40 hours/week, located at our SSC office in Horsham, US.

  


**NEXT STEP**



If this opportunity sparks your interest, don’t wait—apply today! Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis, and interviews will be conducted continuously. We kindly ask you to submit your CV when applying. While you are welcome to include a brief personal note or letter, our evaluation will primarily focus on your skills and qualifications as outlined in your CV, ensuring a fair and unbiased recruitment process.
Please note that the job advertisement may close earlier than the stated deadline if we receive a high volume of applications. This allows us to ensure a fair and efficient recruitment process and give each application the attention it deserves.
  

This is a security-classified position and will require a background check prior to employment.  



For more information about this position, please contact:

  



Jim Fabo, Global LEOP Manager



Phone: +1 267 9626604, Email: jim.fabo@sscspace.com



Clara Burstrand, HR Manager



Email: clara.burstrand@sscspace.com

  


**WE HELP EARTH BENEFIT FROM SPACE**



Swedish Space Corporation (SSC) is a leading global provider of advanced space services, with more than 50 years of experience. We help space organizations, research institutes, commercial and institutional actors from all over the world to get access to space.
With local presence on all continents and about 700 committed employees, we offer specialist expertise in satellite communications and satellite control services, spacecraft operations, rocket and balloon systems, launch services and flight test services, as well as engineering, operations and consultancy services for space missions.
We help Earth benefit from Space.

title: analysstrateg med ansvar för avancerad analys
description:
**Lediga jobb**
===============


**Tullverket söker analysstrateg med ansvar för avancerad analys**
------------------------------------------------------------------


Tullverket är en myndighet med enorma dataresurser och stora ambitioner att nyttja denna som en strategisk tillgång i vårt uppdrag att skapa ett tryggt och säkert samhälle. För att säkerställa att vi nyttjar vår data på ett effektivt och värdeskapande sätt söker vi nu förstärkning i vårt Tullverksövergripande utvecklingsområde Data och analys. Vi söker dig som strategiskt och operativt kan leda arbetet med att identifiera verksamhetsbehov och utveckla Tullverkets förmåga inom avancerad analys utifrån ett helhetsperspektiv.

Utvecklingsområde Data och Analys bistår Tullverkets samtliga staber, avdelningar, utvecklings- och leveransområden med kunskap, kompetens och produkter inom datahantering och -analys, baserat på BI- och AI-teknik. Vi arbetar med förvaltning och innovation samt bedriver förutsättningsskapande utvecklingsarbete inom området. Arbetet utförs i agila team med tvärfunktionell kompetens (IT, juridik, säkerhet, dataanlytiker, verksamhetsexpertis etc.) som är verksamma i ett av utvecklingsområdets tre leveransområden; Data: Styrning och tillgängliggörande, BI: Uppföljning och analys samt AI: Avancerad analys.

**Om tjänsten**

Vill du vara med i arbetet med att utveckla en av Sveriges äldsta myndigheter och skapa förutsättningar för att ta Tullverket in i den datadrivna eran? Som analysstrateg på Tullverket ansvarar du för att bygga upp och utforma myndighetens analysförmåga för ökat värdeskapande, genom att driva metodutveckling inom området utifrån ett verksamhetsperspektiv. Du kommer arbeta både strategiskt och operativt med att identifiera, utveckla och implementera avancerad analys och automatiserade analysflöden med hjälp av moderna metoder och verktyg inom AI. En central del av din tjänst kommer bestå av omvärldsbevakning och att ta del av relevant forskning inom området för att se hur det kan nyttjas praktiskt för att skapa nytta hos Tullverket.

I den specifika tjänsten ingår att leda leveransområde AI – Avancerad analys utifrån ett verksamhetsperspektiv (produktägare). Du ansvarar för den strategiska planeringen och prioriteringen av utvecklingsbehov inom området och arbetar aktivt med samverkan, både internt och externt. Du kommer att leda och koordinera ett team med verksamhetsresurser som helt eller delvis ingår i områdets leveransteam tillsammans med it-resurser och arbeta mycket nära leveransområdesansvarig på IT-avdelningen. Du även att ingå i utvecklingsområdets ledning.

I din tjänst kommer du vidare arbeta med det arkitektoniska arbetet som leveransområdet leder genom att ta fram och underhålla nya teknologier inom datahantering, analyslösningar och AI. Häri ligger också etiska överväganden samt arbete med dokumentation av våra AI-lösningar och dataskydd.

Du kommer vara en del av ett strategiskt viktigt område som är under uppbyggnad och kommer kunna vara med och forma såväl din egen roll som våra arbetsprocesser och inriktning. Vi är i ett expansivt och spännande skede. Tjänsten är placerad på underrättelseavdelningen.

**Vi söker dig som har:**
* Eftergymnasial utbildning inom t.ex. datavetenskap, AI, statistik, matematik eller annan utbildning som arbetsgivaren bedömer som relevant för tjänsten
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av arbete inom Dataanalys, Data Science eller liknande område
* Kunskap och kompetens om statistiska metoder, hypotesprövning och prediktiv analys
* Goda kunskaper i statistikverktyg (SQL, Python och R)
* Förmåga att arbeta med databaser och använda SQL för att extrahera och bearbeta data
* Erfarenhet av att leda större utvecklingsprojekt/-uppdrag
* Utbildning i agil arbetsmetodik och erfarenhet av att leda enligt agil arbetsmetodik
* Erfarenhet av analys- och underrättelsearbete i en brottsbekämpande myndighet
* Förmåga att uttrycka dig väl i tal och skrift på svenska och engelska
* Svenskt medborgarskap.

**Det är meriterande om du har:**
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med datahanteringsplattformar
* Erfarenhet av MLOps och att sätta ML-modeller i produktion
* Erfarenhet av generativ AI on-prem/cloud
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i regulatoriska miljöer med höga säkerhetskrav
* God kännedom om tullproceduren
* Kunskap om utforskande och innovativa arbetssätt.

**Personliga egenskaper**

Vi söker dig med förmåga att engagera, motivera och leda andra människor mot områdets mål. Du är systematisk i ditt arbetssätt och har förmåga att ta initiativ, vara flexibel, se möjligheter och nå resultat.
Samtidigt behöver du ha en förståelse för Tullverkets verksamhet, processer och ramverk och kan tillämpa dina kunskaper på bästa sätt så att de verkligen gör skillnad.

Vi tycker att det är viktigt att du är en professionell teamleader med ett agilt ledarskap och ett bra medarbetarskap. Arbetet innebär många kontakter både internt och externt vilket förutsätter att du som person är bra på att skapa goda relationer, kommunicera och förmedla budskap på ett tydligt sätt. Är du dessutom en prestigelös och respektfull lagspelare som drivs av att lösa utmaningar, då hoppas vi att du söker till oss!

För dig är Tullverkets värdegrund; Helhetssyn – Nytänkande - Ansvarstagande, något helt naturligt.

Vi lägger stor vikt vid personlig lämplighet!

**Övrigt**

Referensnummer: TV-2025-02333.

Placeringsort: Stockholm, Göteborg eller Malmö.

Anställningen är en tillsvidareanställning och kan komma att inledas med 6 månaders provanställning. Individuell lönesättning tillämpas.

Vi ställer höga krav på våra medarbetares säkerhets- och sekretessmedvetenhet. Innan beslut om anställning kommer du att få genomgå drogtest och bakgrundskontroll. Säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen genomförs före anställning, då tjänsten är placerad i säkerhetsklass. Tullverket är en totalförsvarsmyndighet och vid anställning kan du komma att krigsplaceras i Tullverket.

**För mer information och ansökan**

Upplysningar om tjänsten lämnas av Elin Nordin, 08-456 54 68 eller Josefine Sternvik, 031-63 38 19. För frågor om rekryteringsprocessen besvaras av Tullverkets PA-support, 060-67 25 85. Fackliga företrädare är för OFR-P/TULL-KUST, Ulf Persson, 040-661 33 21 och för Saco-S, Katarina Hernhut, 08-456 52 65.

Din ansökan, med ett medföljande personligt brev samt CV, ska ha inkommit till Tullverket senast den 7 februari. Samtliga handlingar ska vara på svenska. Du ansöker via det elektroniska ansökningsformuläret här nedan.

Vi undanber oss all kontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt försäljare av platsannonser.  



2025-01-21

title: Sales Admin
description:
Vi ger samma löfte till våra kollegor som till kunder. Löftet är att alltid vara "beside you", "behind you" och "before you". Vi kallar det för "The Iver way". Nu söker vi en engagerad och driven person inom Sales Admin! Är du en serviceinriktad person med ett öga för detaljer? Då har vi jobbet för dig!
  
  

**Om Iver:**  

Iver är en ledande nordisk helhetsleverantör av molnbaserade IT-tjänster med spetskompetens inom drift, cybersäkerhet, cloud och innovation. Våra tjänster är kritiska inte bara för våra kunder – utan för digitaliseringen av samhället i stort.
  
  

**Om tjänsten:**  

Som Sales Admin blir du en nyckelspelare i vårt säljteam. Du kommer att arbeta nära våra säljare och kunder, med fokus på att skapa en smidig säljprocess och ge exceptionell service. Din roll är att hantera administrativa uppgifter, koordinera projekt och säkerställa effektiv hantering.
  
  

**Exempel på arbetsuppgifter:**  

Stötta i kundevent samt merförsäljnings- och kundvårdsaktiviteter
  
Regelbundet gå igenom öppna ordrar och föra dialogen med KAM om vad som behöver hanteras för att sedan exekvera och följa upp
  
Ha koll på vilka kunder som har öppna fordringar och ha en dialog med kundreskontra, KAM och de operationella avdelningarna om hur dessa ska hanteras
  
Hantering av löpande debitering för kunduppdrag
  
Hantera viss vidarefakturering, support till våra försäljningsvertikaler
  
Supportera Säljprocessen med viss avtalshantering
  
Dokumentationsaktiviteter kopplat till kunder
  
  

Vad erbjuder vi dig på Iver?
  
Iver - We empower our Nordic society.På Iver får du möjlighet att arbeta med den senaste tekniken och vara med på en spännande tillväxtresa. Vi är inkluderande och strävar efter ett genuint samarbete mot gemensamma mål. Inom Iver finns stora möjligheter till utveckling och vi finns här för att inspirera dig till att nå dina yrkesmässiga mål. Vi står bakom dig när du vill lära dig mer – inom ditt specialområde, ledarskap eller nya områden. Hos Iver är du en del av ett ambitiöst och innovativt företag, vilket innebär att förbättra, testa, utvärdera och våga ändra hur vi gör saker är viktiga ingredienser och vi är övertygade om att det är så vi utvecklas.
  
  

**Vem söker vi:**  

För att lyckas i rollen som Sales Admin hos oss tror vi att du har tidigare erfarenhet av att arbeta med administration och stöd inom en försäljningsorganisation, med fördel inom IT branschen eller liknande där fokus är B2B, tjänsteförsäljning och/eller licenshantering.
  
  

**Vidare tror vi att du:**  

Högskoleutbildning inom ekonomi, business administration eller liknande med erfarenhet av att hantera fakturering, kravhantering och kredit.
  
Erfarenhet av administration och uppföljning i CRM och ERP system.
  
Är strukturerad och har förmåga att hantera flera parallella uppgifter.
  
Är noggrann med ett öga för detaljer och ser ständiga förbättringsmöjligheter.
  
Har goda kunskaper i Microsoft Office-paketet, särskilt Excel.
  
Behärskar svenska och engelska flytande i tal och skrift.
  
Är en lagspelare med en positiv inställning och ett stort engagemang
  
  

**Meriterande krav:**  

Erfarenhet av leverantörsfakturor inom IT-drift och förmåga att avgöra vad som ingår/ingår inte i tjänst. Erfarenhet av licenshantering CSP lösningar.
  
  

**Placeringsort:**  

Iver finns på 25 platser I Sverige & Norge, för denna tjänst ser vi att utgår från vårt kontor I Solna eller Västerås.
  
Sök till oss!
  
Urval sker löpande, tjänsten kan tillsättas före sista ansökningsdag. Iver eftersträvar en jämn könsfördelning och värdesätter etnisk och kulturell mångfald. Önskad start är snarast eller enligt överenskommelse. Sista ansökningsdag 2025-02-23. Du är välkommen att kontakta Robin Dronsfield (robin.dronsfield@iver.se)vid frågor eller funderingar kring tjänsten.Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

title: Vi söker en djurvårdare/receptionist till vår smådjursklinik!
description:
Är du en person som trivs med att arbeta i en omväxlande roll och vill vara en del av ett engagerat team på vår smådjursklinik? Vi söker nu en djurvårdare/receptionist som kan dela sin tid mellan receptionen och att assistera vid veterinärbehandlingar.
  
**Som receptionist:** Du är klinikens ansikte utåt och den första personen våra kunder möter. Du kommer att vara den som hälsar välkomna, svarar i telefon och hjälper till med bokningar. Dina arbetsuppgifter inkluderar att ta emot kunder och djur, göra tidsbokningar, kassaarbete, kontakt med försäkringsbolag samt försäljning och beställningar i butiken. Vi söker dig som har goda datorkunskaper och ett bra siffersinne, samt kan hantera stressiga situationer på ett lugnt och professionellt sätt.
  
**Som djurvårdare:** Du kommer att assistera våra veterinärer och ta hand om djur under behandling, hjälpa till med städning och hålla kliniken i ordning. Det är viktigt att du är van vid att arbeta med djur och har ett genuint intresse för deras välmående. Erfarenhet av djurvård och/eller utbildning inom området är meriterande.
  
  

**Vi söker dig som:**  

Är kommunikativ, glad och öppen.
  
Har ett gott siffersinne och goda datorkunskaper.
  
Har erfarenhet av att arbeta med djur eller är utbildad djurvårdare.
  
Har kunskap om Provet Cloud-programmet (meriterande men ej krav).
  
Har förmåga att hantera både stressiga och vardagliga situationer med ett leende på läpparna.

title: Engineering Manager
description:
Stockholm | On-site
  
Applications considered on a rolling basis
  
Join Simployer as an Engineering Manager and lead a team of skilled developers in building cutting-edge HR tech solutions! We’re looking for a hands-on leader who can drive technical excellence, foster collaboration, and support the professional growth of the team.
  
Your Role
  
Lead and mentor a development team, ensuring high performance and engagement.
  
Drive architectural decisions and technical strategy.
  
Collaborate with stakeholders to align technical solutions with business goals.
  
Support team members' growth through coaching and feedback.
  
Foster an agile and inclusive team culture.
  
Your Background
  
Experience as an Engineering Manager or Senior Developer with leadership responsibilities.
  
Strong technical background in Node.js, TypeScript, cloud platforms (AWS/GCP/Azure).
