title: Project Manager
description:
Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you’d like, where you’ll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you’ll be able to reimagine what’s possible. Join us and help the world’s leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, more inclusive world.
   

  

**THE ROLE**
 Within Capgemini, the Cloud Infrastructure Services business provides leading solutions to large global customers. The unit focuses on integrating and connecting resources to increase the speed, agility and cost efficiency of our clients’ transformation initiatives. We are a global team of professionals who help organizations meet their business goals by transforming and managing their IT infrastructure landscape – leveraging innovations.
   

  

 We are now looking to strengthen our team with an experienced Senior Technical Project Manager! This position will be located in Malmö or Copenhagen, but you will be a part of a Nordic team. For this role Swedish or Danish language skills are mandatory.
   

  

 As Technical Project Manager, You will take responsibility for leading a range of projects within Capgemini’s Cloud Infrastructure Services. Our Project Managers work in close co-operation with large business clients managing various projects from the beginning to the end. This means you will manage the client relationship, set realistic expectations within agreed cost and time scales, and ensure customer satisfaction. In practice, You will contribute actively in assisting with pre-sales, manage project teams and monitor progress using best practices and appropriate quality standards.
   

  

**YOUR PROFILE**
 Qualifications:
   

  

* Proven track record in IT project management especially in the infra, cloud and/or cyber field
* Deepened understanding of relevant technologies and architectures
* Several years of experience in delivering customized projects for high demand end-users
* Solemn project planning methods and budgeting skills
* Know-how of activities related to infrastructure installation and configurations
* Ability to work with various third parties and service providers
* Excellent communication and prioritization skills
* Swedish/Danish and English fluent language skills


**What You’ll Love About Working Here**
* A challenging career in a vibrant environment with access to extensive training and a global network of experts
* Opportunities to work on real-world problems and help transform leading organizations
* A company culture driven by core values: Honesty, Trust, Freedom, Team Spirit, Modesty, Fun, and Boldness
* A strong commitment to inclusion, diversity, and supporting the whole person
* An innovative culture that promotes learning, growth, and shared success


 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fuelled by its market leading capabilities in AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of €22.5 billion.

title: Customer Operations Engineer - Pilot Partner
description:
Scania is undergoing a transformation from being a leading supplier of trucks, buses, and engines to providing complete and sustainable transport solutions. Together with TRATON and our sister brands MAN, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International, we are working to shape the future of mobility with innovative and environmentally conscious solutions. Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do. Together, we are at the forefront of creating a sustainable future.
   

  

 Are you passionate about supporting customers, solving technical challenges, and contributing to the e-mobility revolution? Join Scania Pilot Partner’s Operations team as a Customer Operations Engineer, where you’ll play a vital role in creating innovative solutions for a sustainable future.
   

  

 Who We Are
   

  

 Scania Pilot Partner is a dedicated function focused on accelerating the transition to e-mobility. We operate with an entrepreneurial “company mindset,” taking end-to-end responsibility for the e-mobility business, including proof-of-concept solutions where no mature alternatives exist.
   

  

 Our team thrives on high integrity, flat hierarchies, and collective leadership. We are highly diverse, with members based in Australia, Germany, Gothenburg, and Södertälje. By supporting uptime for our customers and managing profit and loss risks, we aim to lead the way in sustainable innovation.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Customer Operations Engineer, you will be the go-to specialist for Pilot Partner customers, providing technical support and ensuring smooth operations throughout the lifecycle of our products. Your expertise will include diagnosing issues via control systems, parameterizing software, and solving technical problems on-site and remotely.
   

  

 This role offers a unique opportunity to gain international sales experience and work closely with Scania’s end customers from a Head Office perspective.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Provide lifecycle support for Pilot Partner customers.
* Troubleshoot technical issues, acting as a "flying doctor" for complex cases.
* Collaborate with the team and independently support customers at Södertälje and global customer sites, including Sweden, Norway, Germany, and Australia.
* Support existing product solutions and contribute to the development of future Pilot Partner innovations.
* Work with diverse technologies, including platforms outside the modular toolbox (e.g., trailers, solar panels).


 Who You Are
   

  

 To succeed in this position, you should:
   

  

  

* Be a dedicated team player who thrives in a dynamic environment with changing plans.
* Be customer-focused, service-minded, and passionate about Scania’s success.
* Possess strong communication skills and the ability to engage effectively across all organizational levels.
* Have hands-on experience supporting customers with heavy vehicles.
* Be organized, trustworthy, and skilled at building long-term relationships.


**Qualifications**
* Degree in Engineering or equivalent experience.
* Background in R&D, software development, and supporting operations where uptime is critical.
* Strong product knowledge, including experience with vehicle components such as rear axle ratios and software downloads.
* Driving license for trucks and trailers (CE) is required.


 While meeting all qualifications is ideal, we value passion, attitude, and a commitment to customer success. If you don’t meet every requirement, we still encourage you to apply and demonstrate how your unique experiences and skills can contribute to the team.
   

  

 What We Offer
   

  

  

* Opportunity to work with cutting-edge e-mobility solutions.
* International exposure and travel as part of a global, diverse team.
* A collaborative, entrepreneurial environment that values inclusion and innovation.


 Application
   

  

 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-01-12. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

 If you have questions or would like more information, please contact hiring manager: Andreas Fallberg, andreas.fallberg@scania.com
   

  

**We look forward to your application!**

title: Mid-Senior Full Stack Engineer
description:
**About Sinch**
 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**Description**
 Develop, architect and scale the core infrastructure for Sinch's web applications. Be part of in a small cross functional team that sets its own objectives and goals with responsibility for every stage of product development life cycle from planning and design to implementation, testing, deployment, monitoring and maintenance, you build It you run it.
   

  

 Your work will be focused around the common platform used to that makes up the core of the product line; The code you write will be consumed by used by many different teams and is a key enabler in the product line. You will solve problems across the enterprise, focusing not only on how to deliver a great product today but setting the foundations for the future.
   

  

**Tech Stack:** 
 NodeJS, Java, React, Typescript
   

  

**Requirements**
* A strong software engineering background
* In-depth knowledge of the web platform and ecosystem
* Expertise in modern front-end technologies.
* Solid track record working with Typescript in a professional or open-source setting.
* Experience building services on the backend
* Fluency in English


**Good to have**
* Experience using design systems
* Experience making architectural decisions that have high impact
* Experience with Web components and the latest Web APIs
* Experience with AWS, Kubernetes and other cloud native technologies


**Our Hiring Process**
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
   

  

 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Solution Architect for Order Management and Outbound IT
description:
Are you ready to be part of transformational projects that will drive business transformation and enhance speed and flexibility? At Scania, we play a crucial role in providing the right IT solutions and transforming the IT landscape to support our journey towards electrification and business expansion. We are looking for an awesome new colleague to join our team of IT professionals!
   

  

**About Us:**
 We are a dynamic team of Business Analysts, Architects, and Service Managers dedicated to upholding the integrity of our services and recommending the best IT solutions to meet Scania's needs in the Order Management and Outbound area. Our responsibilities include creating and maintaining the Target and Reference views of the architecture within our domain, ensuring we move the IT landscape towards our set architectural direction. We pride ourselves on being a diverse team with varied backgrounds and experiences, working together in an open and collaborative atmosphere.
   

  

**Your Role:**
 As a Solution Architect, you will:
   

  

  

* Work primarily within the Order Management and Outbound domain, recommending suitable IT solutions that align with the product development process.
* Understand the current architecture of our existing landscape and contribute to the development of the reference architecture.
* Support our product teams in their journey towards the reference architecture.
* Facilitate the reuse of ideas, applications, components, and proven patterns within stakeholders and across the enterprise by collaborating with other architects.
* Work cross-functionally with other roles and departments to drive the overall architecture forward, together with the rest of the architect community and the product teams within the department.


**What You Bring:**
* An agile mindset and experience working closely with development and business teams.
* The ability to switch between overview and details based on the context.
* Experience in a strategic role, architecting technical solutions in a complex IT landscape.
* Expertise in cloud implementation and data-driven transformation (integration technologies and streaming).
* Modelling experience and the ability to develop different views at various levels (TOGAF, ArchiMate).
* Excellent communication and presentation skills in English. It’s an advantage if you can communicate in Swedish as well.
* A background in the Manufacturing industry with knowledge of industry standards such as ISA95, MESA Model, and SCOR, and experience in Industry 4.0 implementations is a plus.


**More About You**
 For you to have fun and thrive in this position we believe you are a curious person who stays up-to-date on industry trends, new technologies and is receptive to new ideas and influences. You have a pragmatic a positive mindset and enjoys networking & collaboration rather than working by yourself.
   

  

 If this sounds like you, don’t hesitate to apply. We are interviewing continuously. A background check might be conducted for this position.
   

  

**Questions?**
 For questions please contact the recruiting manager, Richard Fahlström Richard.fahlstrom@scania.com

title: Software Engineering Manager - Container and Virtualisation Infrastructure
description:
Our mission is to build a next-generation private cloud infrastructure, combining KVM, Ceph, and SDN technologies to create a data center scale cloud that 'just works' and provides a mission-critical cloud for edge and core enterprise deployments. We're hiring engineering managers with experience in high-quality microservice architectures and high-performance team leadership who also have deep familiarity with Linux kernel, virtualisation, storage and networking.
   

  

 LXD components span the entire software stack from low-level kernel features to the upper level management API/CLI. Our most effective engineers are fluent in all these layers, and able to anticipate the consequences of design and engineering choices elsewhere in a complex distributed system.
   

  

 As an engineering manager at Canonical you must have a solid technical background, but your responsibility is to run an effective team and develop the colleagues you manage. You are expected to help them grow as engineers, do important work, do it outstandingly well, find professional and personal satisfaction, and work well with colleagues and the community. Technical leadership experience and a background in software engineering are necessary prerequisites for this role. You will be expected to lead, challenge, and develop engineers, positively influence the culture, facilitate technical delivery, and work with your team on strategy and execution.
   

  

 The successful candidate will have experience leading successful, collaborative engineering teams, and demonstrate the ability to solve challenging distributed systems problems and deep knowledge of Linux.
   

  

***Location***
 : This is a remote position available in EMEA and the Americas.
   

  

 What you will focus on
   

  

* Lead a team of remote engineers
* Develop talent through coaching, mentoring, feedback and hands-on career development
* Set and manage expectations with other engineering teams, senior management, and external stakeholders
* Advocate and advance modern software development practices
* Participate in the engineering process through code and architectural review
* Engage with teams at Canonical, the open source community and partners
* Work from home with global travel for 4 to 6 weeks per year for internal and external events


 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* You understand modern Linux cloud computing technologies, including networking, storage, containers and K8s
* You love developing and growing people and have a strong track record of doing it
* You are focused on success and the delivery of timely, high quality software
* You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree
* You have strong written and verbal technical communication skills
* You have experience programming in C and/or Go.


 What we offer you
   

  

 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

 Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
   

  

 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Data Analytics Engineer
description:
Are you ready to be a key contributor within the Data & Analytics Engineering department at NOBA Bank Group? Your focus will be on advancing analytics capabilities, optimizing data workflows, driving innovation in the cloud, and unlocking the full potential of the organization’s most valuable asset – data.
   

  

**About The Role**
 The Data & Analytics Engineering department comprises specialized teams focused on Data Infrastructure Engineering, Analytics Engineering, and Data Management.
   

  

 As a Data Analytics Engineer, you'll play a central role in building and optimizing the organization's supporting analytics layer, collaborating across the bank. This role offers broad opportunities to grow and make a tangible impact!
   

  

 We offer a hybrid working model with two common in-office days. While we value flexibility, we also prioritize collaboration, team-building, and enjoying fikas and after-work gatherings together!
   

  

**Main Tasks**
* Design and implement efficient data models, focusing on analytics workflows and end-user usability.
* Build robust and scalable data pipelines to support business intelligence and analytics needs.
* Collaborate closely with internal stakeholders, such as Risk, Finance, and IT, to ensure data solutions align with business needs.
* Ensure data quality, security, and compliance throughout the analytics lifecycle.
* Drive technical improvements, introducing modern tools and processes to enhance analytics capabilities.
* Partner with other engineers to align transformation processes for analytics purposes.


**We Are Looking For Someone Who**
 Enjoys working with analytics, modern data practices, and creating insights that drive decisions. We believe you are a detail-oriented and proactive person who thrives in a collaborative environment and enjoy learning new technologies. You approach challenges with a “can-do” attitude and excel in analytical thinking and problem-solving. For this role you’ll need:
   

  

* Work experience in a similar role within data, analytics, or software development.
* An academic degree related to analytics engineering, data engineering, or similar fields.
* Proficiency in ETL processes, designing analytics-ready datasets, and ensuring clean and usable data for stakeholders.
* Proficiency in Databricks, dbt (SQL), and related reporting tools.
* Experience with Power BI or similar BI tools.
* Strong English skills, with a good understanding of Swedish and/or Norwegian.


**It’s a Plus If You Have**
* Experience with Microsoft’s data stack (Azure, SQL, and other cloud services).
* A background in data roles within the financial sector.
* Knowledge of Agile and Scrum methodologies.


**Our Offer To You**
* Freedom with Responsibility: Flexible working arrangements to suit your work style.
* Career Development: Opportunities to grow and develop in your role.
* Feedback Culture: A supportive environment that encourages open communication.
* Coaching Leadership: Managers who guide and support your career journey.
* A Caring Company Culture: We genuinely care about each other!


 In addition to this, it is important to us that you recognize yourself in our values:
 **we are wholehearted, we collaborate and we take the lead.**
**Practical Information**
 Start: By agreement
   

  

 Location: Stockholm or Oslo
   

  

 Form of employment: Permanent employment (6-month probationary period)
   

  

 Working hours: 08:30-17:00 (June-August: 08:30-16:00)
   

  

**Have you heard of NOBAVERSE?**
 In our NOBAVERSE, we value openness, trust, and diversity. Here, you can influence your own development and have fun along the way to achieving our goals – all in a workplace that’s a little extra
 *bubbly* 
 ! ✨
   

  

 Read more about our employee value proposition on our careers page.
   

  

 We strive for diversity of knowledge and experiences among our employees and welcome all applicants who are qualified for the position. We are committed to a recruitment process free from discrimination that provides equal opportunities for all.
   

  

**What happens when you have submitted your application?**
 The number of steps in the recruitment process may vary depending on the position you are applying for, but we always try to keep the process as short and concise as possible, to protect your application experience. You can read more about how our recruitment process works in the FAQ.
   

  

 If you have any questions or concerns about the position, please contact the responsible recruiter Sarah Wahlstedt Corméry at sarah.wahlstedt.cormery@nordax.se .
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application! 🙏✨
   

  

*NOBA Bank protects your privacy and, with reference to the GDPR, would like to ask you not to include any sensitive personal data in your application. Examples of sensitive personal data can be information about ethnic origin, political opinions, religious beliefs or information about your health, such as sick leave. If you have protected personal information, please inform the responsible recruiter so that we can handle your personal data correctly.*

title: Energy Solution Engineer
company_industry: Telecommunications and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Söker du en möjlighet att ansluta dig till ett team som utvecklar våra viktigaste siter i core-nätet i Sverige? Som Energy Solution Engineer kommer du att ha en viktig roll i att säkra energieffektivitet avseende kyla på Telias anläggningar.
   

  

 För att vi ska bli framgångsrika behöver vi leverera på tid, budget och med kvalitet för att säkra Telias viktigaste infrastruktur. Vill du vara med?
   

  

**Är det här din nästa möjlighet?**
 Jag heter Anneli Lindholm och leder avdelningen Technology & Energy Solutions inom Telia Infra Transport Network & Datacenter. Vi är ett team på 12 personer som har ett övergripande ansvar för teknik- och leverantörsval, dimensionering av kraft- och kylanläggningar samt en sammanhållande roll gällande inköp av el för Telia Sverige.
   

  

 I rollen som Energy Solution Engineer hanterar du inkommande kapacitetsförfrågningar avseende kyla på våra anläggningar. Du ansvarar för att ta emot förfrågningar och analysera dessa samt agera beställare där du leder och följer upp våra entreprenörer utifrån budget- och tidsplan.
   

  

 Du är tydlig i din kommunikation och säkrar att samtliga inblandade känner sig väl uppdaterade gällande din planering. I rollen arbetar du tillsammans med andra kollegor men självständigt arbete förekommer till stor del.
   

  

**Är det här du?**
 Som Energy Solution Engineer kommer du att arbeta med strategiska planer och innovation inom området för energisystem. Du är bekväm med att hantera flera uppgifter samtidigt och kan ta snabba beslut när det krävs.
   

  

**Vi ser gärna att du har:**
* Teknisk utbildning eller motsvarande erfarenhet inom VVS/energiteknik, gärna med inriktning på kylsystem för telekom/datakom (ICT) eller geokyla samt luft- och vätskekylsystem.
* Kunskap inom styr- och övervakning för kylsystem.


 Andra ämnen som engagerar dig är hållbarhet, säkerhet och digitalisering.
   

  

**För att lyckas i rollen tror vi att du:**
 Har ett gediget intresse för teknik- och energifrågor.
   

  

* Har en god planeringsförmåga och arbetar på ett systematiskt sätt.
* Trivs att arbeta tillsammans med andra mot gemensamma mål.
* Har ett intresse av att förenkla och standardisera verksamhet och arbetssätt.


 Vi på Infra bidrar till Telias affär genom att koppla upp Sverige och driva digitaliseringen framåt. Att ständigt förbättra, modernisera och tillgängliggöra Sveriges bästa fasta och mobila nät är kärnan i vad vi gör.
   

  

**Mer än bara ett jobb!**
 Oavsett vilket jobb du söker hos oss, ger vi dig verktygen och stödet du behöver för att styra din personliga utveckling. Vi vill hjälpa dig att utvecklas både på ett personligt plan och i din yrkesroll. Hos oss blir du en del av ett kreativt, motiverande och välkomnade företag där alla kan vara sig själva, med likvärdiga möjligheter att utvecklas. Vi respekterar människor och värdesätter mångfald. Förutom en attraktiv och inkluderande arbetsmiljö erbjuder vi flexibilitet och ett brett utbud av olika förmåner.
   

  

**Känner du dig träffad?**
 Då kan det här vara rätt tjänst för dig. Vi lägger stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper och hoppas att just du känner dig manad att söka.
   

  

 Vill du veta mer om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta mig på +46 72-717 41 01 eller anneli.lindholm@teliacompany.com
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan. För att kunna hantera dina personuppgifter på ett säkert sätt, ber vi dig att ansöka via vårt rekryteringssystem. Vi har inte möjlighet att ta emot ansökningar via e-post eller andra kanaler. Urval och intervjuer sker löpande, tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum.
 **Sista ansökningsdatum är** 
**2025-02-05.**
*Telia är en del av Sveriges kritiska infrastruktur och delar av vår verksamhet omfattas av lagstiftning om säkerhetsskydd. Innan anställning kan ske krävs godkänd säkerhetsprövning, som i förekommande fall, kan medföra krav på visst medborgarskap.*
*B-körkort och goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, såväl tal som skrift, är en förutsättning.*
**Welcome to Telia - Join us and make better happen!**

title: Nätverkstekniker
description:
Har du erfarenhet inom nätverk och infrastruktur och är redo att ta nästa steg i din karriär? Hos Amendo Tech får du möjligheten att arbeta med ledande företag inom bank, finans, retail, myndigheter, produktbolag och innovativa startups. Vi söker just nu engagerade konsulter för kommande interimsuppdrag som kan stärka våra kunders tekniska landskap och säkerställa deras infrastruktur och nätverk på högsta nivå.
   

  

 Din kompetens & profil
   

  

 Vi söker dig som är kunnig inom nätverksarkitektur och säkerhet och som har erfarenhet av att designa, implementera och övervaka nätverkslösningar i komplexa miljöer. Du har arbetat med några av följande tekniker:
   

  

* Nätverksprotokoll och teknik: Stark kompetens inom TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP, VLAN, VPN och routingprotokoll (t.ex. OSPF, BGP).
* Brandväggar och säkerhet: Erfarenhet av brandväggar, IDS/IPS, och andra säkerhetslösningar, exempelvis Cisco ASA, Palo Alto eller Fortinet.
* Trådlösa nätverk: Erfarenhet av att konfigurera och hantera trådlösa nätverk (WLAN) och Wi-Fi-lösningar.
* Lastbalansering och redundans: Kunskap om lastbalanserare och failover-lösningar för att säkerställa hög tillgänglighet.
* Nätverksövervakning och felsökning: Vana vid att använda övervakningsverktyg.
* Certifieringar: Gärna certifieringar inom Cisco (t.ex. CCNA, CCNP) eller motsvarande erfarenhet.
* Molnplattformar: Gedigen erfarenhet av AWS, Azure, eller Google Cloud Platform samt arbete med hybridmoln-arkitektur.
* Virtuella miljöer: Erfarenhet av virtualiseringsteknologier som VMware, Hyper-V eller KVM.
* Serveradministration: Kompetens inom Windows- och Linux-servrar, inklusive säkerhetspatchning och hantering av Active Directory.
* Lagring och backup: Kunskap om SAN, NAS och backuplösningar som Veeam eller Commvault.
* Automatisering och scripting: Förmåga att effektivisera och automatisera arbetsflöden med hjälp av PowerShell, Python eller Ansible.
* Säkerhet och övervakning: Förståelse för säkerhetspraxis och vana vid övervakningsverktyg för driftssäkerhet, exempelvis Zabbix eller Splunk.


 Du har en vilja, nyfikenhet och drivkraft att vilja skapa nytta hos kunden samt lära dig nytt. En problemlösare som inte är rädd för att ta initiativ och vågar utforska nya vägar och arbetssätt. Du har en förmåga att snabbt sätta dig in i nya sammanhang och processer. Du får saker gjorda och ser kunskapsluckor som en möjlighet för personlig utveckling. Du är analytisk och har stor förståelse för vikten av service och kommunikation.
   

  

 Som konsult kommer du att ställas inför en rad olika utmaningar, både från ett socialt och pragmatiskt perspektiv. Därför tror vi att du är öppen och ödmjuk för både förändring och för olikheter. Du har ett agilt sätt att möta problem och kan se dem från olika vinklar.
   

  

 Om Amendo Tech
   

  

 Amendo Tech är din heltäckande partner inom IT och tech. Som vår konsultkollega blir du en del av ett personligt bolag som lägger stor vikt vid kompetens, mångfald och innovation. Vi ser varje medarbetares unika perspektiv som en styrka, och vi erbjuder ett öppet klimat där vi stöttar dig att nå dina mål. Tillsammans bidrar vi till att forma en bättre framtid genom teknik och kreativitet.
   

  

 Vi är ett expansivt bolag med stark lokal närvaro i Stockholm samt i sydvästra och norra Sverige. Följ Amendo Tech på Linkedin!
   

  

 Amendo Tech är en del av Amendo Group som har arbetat med framtidens kompetens sedan 2001. I koncernen ingår även Amendo Bemanning & Rekrytering och Lagotto Executive Search & Interim. Tillsammans möter vi dig där du står, och tar dig dit du vill. Vi är din engagerade och trygga kompetenspartner.
   

  

 Frågor och kontakt
   

  

 Vid frågor eller funderingar om våra konsultuppdrag är du varmt välkommen att höra av dig till Amendo Techs Kiara Bergqvist på kiara.bergqvist@amendotech.se eller Johanna Hallenberg på johanna.hallenberg@amendotech.se. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig, varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Enterprise Account Manager - Public Sector
description:
**Humble, Honest, with Heart.**
**The Opportunity**
 Nutanix is looking for a
 **Public Sector Sales Executive,** 
 you will be a highly visible, key player within the Nutanix field sales team, tasked to drive net new business in large Government Agencies, Healthcare Regions, Universities and top Government Companies.
   

  

 You are responsible for selling Nutanix’s Products and Solutions directly to large Public customers and prospects. You will also be working closely with Presales Engineers and the extended account team.
   

  

**About The Team**
 At Nutanix, you will be joining the Swedish team. This team is known for its exceptional performance and in combination with a consistent class-leading employee-NPS score. The team strongly value collaboration across functions and hierarchies, making it a fun, dynamic and rewarding environment to be a part of. As part of your role, you will be expected to travel within Sweden to visit prospective and existing customers. This travel requirement provides you with the opportunity to engage directly with clients and build strong relationships, further enhancing the impact and reach of your work within the region.
   

  

**Your Role**
* As a Public Sector Sales Executive, you will be a highly visible, key player within the Nutanix field sales team, tasked to drive net new business in large Government Agencies, Healthcare Regions, Universities and top Government Companies.
* You will work in close partnership with an experienced technical Pre-sales engineer
* Forge new and cultivate existing Partner relationships (Resellers, Global Systems Integrators and Alliances) to align go-to-market strategies at the account level.
* Work collaboratively across Nutanix cross-functional teams such as Channel Sales, Marketing, Sales Operations, and Product Management to ensure the best possible coverage for your accounts.
* Drive accurate and timely sales forecasting through SFDC
* Develop account plans for Tier 1 Accounts
* Build and strengthen the business relationship with current accounts and new prospects by promoting Nutanix’s impact across other Public Sector organisations.
* Recommend Public Sector marketing strategies


**What You Will Bring**
* >7 years of outside software sales experience
* A track record of exceeding sales quotas in multiple, continuous years.
* Keen ability to develop new accounts and penetrate new divisions and organizations within your assigned accounts.
* Expertise in selling technology solutions to the Swedish Public Sector, having an existing network of relevant customer stakeholders within this sector which you will utilize.
* An aptitude to articulate how Nutanix technology solves business problems, acting as a trusted advisor to the most demanding public sector organisations in Sweden
* Deep understanding of the competitive landscape and how Nutanix differentiates
* Deep understanding of the customers and partner ecosystem in the region
* Strong verbal and written communication skills, including presentation skills for large audiences
* An entrepreneurial spirit with an affinity for growth, collaboration, and teamwork.
* Highly organized, with deep knowledge of account planning and strategy.
* An expert in Target Account Selling and consultative solution selling
* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience


 This position is primarily remote. There is no specific in-office requirement, however, there may be circumstances where you may be required to come into a local office for a specific purpose, and/or to travel to other locations based on business needs.

title: Maritime Infrastructure Governance Specialist
company_industry: Environmental Services, Non-profit Organizations, and Research Services
description:
Become part of our international non-profit research institute working to bridge science, policy and practice for a sustainable future for all. At Stockholm Environment Institute (SEI), you will be joining a world-leading research institute in its field. Our dynamic and expanding workplace employs around 140 people at a centrally located, activity-based HQ office in Stockholm, with an additional 200 employees in seven centres globally.
 



  





 SEI’s Water, Coasts and Ocean (WCO) team promotes knowledge and creates tools for more inclusive and resilient blue spaces in a changing world. Our work explores the planning of water, coasts, and marine areas, as well as the governance of associated ecosystems, activities, infrastructure, services, risks and economies. The WCO strategy is operationalized through a portfolio of projects connected to three pillars: Blue Economy, One Water and Resilient Infrastructure.
 



  





**The role** 




 We are looking for a Marine Infrastructure Governance Specialist to strengthen our projects in maritime innovation and sustainable coastal development. This role is ideal for a mid-career professional with strong writing skills, a collaborative mindset, and an interest in exploring the intersection of governance, sustainability and business innovation in marine infrastructure.
 



 You will support ongoing projects, including Living Lab East (Baltic Proper) and other activities under SEI’s C2B2 program (Co-Creating Better Blue).
 



  





**Key responsibilities:** 



* Collaborate with multidisciplinary teams to advance sustainable governance and innovation in marine and coastal infrastructure.
* Facilitate dialogue with stakeholders, including municipalities, businesses, and community organizations, to co-create solutions for marine challenges.
* Analyse business models and economic impacts to support sustainable development in the blue economy.
* Contribute to policy recommendations, technical reports, and actionable strategies to enhance governance of marine activities and infrastructure.
* Organize and lead stakeholder workshops, consultations and other engagement activities.
* Produce high-quality publications and project outputs that effectively communicate complex ideas.
* Support proposal development to expand SEI’s portfolio of marine and coastal projects.



  





**Who you are** 




 We are seeking a motivated professional who thrives in a collaborative environment and is passionate about advancing sustainable and inclusive solutions for marine governance and infrastructure.
 



  





**Required qualifications:** 



* At least
 **5 years of experience** 
 in marine governance, infrastructure development, or a related field.
* Strong communication and writing skills, with the ability to produce impactful publications and reports.
* A basic understanding of business models and economic principles related to sustainable development in marine sectors.
* Knowledge of governance processes, permitting frameworks, or environmental policies relevant to marine and coastal sectors.
* Experience working with diverse stakeholders, including businesses, local governments, and communities.
* Fluency in English and Swedish



  





**Preferred skills and experience:** 



* Background in environmental science, economics, engineering, maritime logistics or other relevant disciplines.
* Experience in multi-stakeholder or innovation projects.
* Familiarity with EU-funded projects and their requirements.
* Interest in promoting equitable transitions within the blue economy.



  





**Why join SEI?** 



* Contribute to transformative solutions for sustainable marine and coastal development.
* Be part of a supportive, inclusive and internationally respected institute.
* Work in a creative, multidisciplinary environment addressing critical global challenges.



  





**Employment with SEI HQ includes:** 



* Collective agreement, including occupational pension and many other collectively agreed benefits.
* Annual healthcare contribution and additional benefits aimed at promoting employee well-being, such as annual health check-ups.
* Opportunities for professional growth and development.
* Flexible work hours, 37.5-hour workweek and a generous number of vacation days.
* The opportunity to be part of tackling environmental and development challenges and developing solutions for a sustainable future for all.



  





**Additional information:** 




 This is a full-time, temporary position, with the possibility of a permanent contract, depending on performance and funding. The start date is as soon as possible or by arrangement.
 



  





 The position is open to applicants who have legal rights to live and work in the EU/EEA.
 



  





 SEI is an equal opportunity employer, and we consider all applicants based on their qualifications and competencies. We are committed to ensuring diversity and equality within our organization and encourage applicants from diverse backgrounds to apply.
 



  





**How to apply** 




 We are reviewing applications and interviewing on an ongoing basis, so please submit your application as soon as possible.
 **The application period will remain open until the position is filled** 
 .
 



  





 We are conducting this recruitment in collaboration with Marinkraft.
 



  





 #SEI #ledigajobb #maritimInfrastruktur #hållbarhet #jobbmöjlighet #miljö #ledarskap #BlueEconomy #sustainability #OffshoreDevelopment #jobalert #research # environment

title: Golang System Software Engineer - Containers / Virtualisation
description:
Our mission is to build a next-generation private cloud infrastructure, combining KVM, Ceph, and SDN technologies to create a data center scale cloud that 'just works' and provides a mission-critical cloud for edge and core enterprise deployments. We are hiring a Golang software engineer to work on the low level Go codebase sitting between our REST API and the low level C libraries used to manage containers and virtual machines. We are looking for system-level developers with experience in design and data management/modeling.
   

  

 LXD components span the entire software stack from low-level kernel features to the upper level management API/CLI. Our most effective engineers are fluent in all these layers, and able to anticipate the consequences of design and engineering choices elsewhere in a complex distributed system.
   

  

 This is an opportunity for someone who wants to have a meaningful impact on modern cloud computing technologies. Canonical offers a fun, fast-paced team environment and a career full of learning and development.
   

  

***Location***
 : This is a remote position available in EMEA and the Americas.
   

  

 What you will focus on
   

  

* Design, implement and document system level Go code
* Model data, design database schema and implement data storage in a dqlite (SQL) database
* Maintain code quality through static analysis, unit and system tests
* Collaborate proactively with a distributed team
* Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions
* Work from home with global travel 2 to 4 weeks/year for internal and external events


 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* You have experience programming in Go and C
* You are knowledgeable in networking and storage technologies
* You have experience with two or more of: cloud computing, virtualisation, containers, distributed systems, open source community
* You are curious, flexible, articulate and accountable
* You value soft skills and are enterprising, thoughtful and self-motivated
* You have a bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree


 What we offer you
   

  

 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

 Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
   

  

 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Business Controller – Stockholm (Hybrid)
company: GatedTalent - Connecting Top Executive Search Firms And Executives
description:
This role involves close teamwork with other controllers daily, making clear, inspiring, and inclusive communication a key aspect.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**

title: Lead AI Developer
description:
*Are you passionate about developing innovative AI and automation solutions?* 




  





 Zimply are on a mission to unlock value through cutting-edge technology and automation. That’s why they have developed AI assistants designed to tackle repetitive tasks across a wide range of industries. By automating these time-consuming activities, Zimply empowers people to focus on what truly matters.
 



  





 We are now looking for a Lead AI Developer to join in creating the AI and automation solutions of the future. If you have a passion for automation and AI, and solid experience with Python, we want to hear from you!
 



  





**About the Role** 




 As the Lead AI Developer, you will become a key player in the mission to streamline and automate processes using innovative technologies. You’ll be part of leading the design and development of architecture for AI solutions, with a particular focus on Python, Automation, prompt engineering and LLM (Large Language Model) development.
 



  





**You will:** 



* Work in close collaboration with the CTO to design robust and scalable architecture for AI solutions.
* Guide the team and lead the implementation and development of automation solutions in Python.
* Work with and implement tools / frameworks like Playwright, Selenium, Robocorp, Cypress, or similar to create smooth automation workflows.
* Collaborate closely with the team to ensure high quality and operational reliability in the solutions, both technically and functionally.



  





**About you** 




 We believe you are a structured and focused person who naturally takes initiative. You have great organizational and problem-solving skills, and thrive in an entrepreneurial, fast-paced environment. You enjoy working in a close-knit team towards shared goals and want to grow together with your colleagues and the company.
 



  





**To thrive and succeed in this role, we believe you have:** 



* At least 5 years of experience in Python development
* Solid experience working with automation in Python and tools like Playwright, Selenium, Robocorp, or Cypress
* Deep understanding of architectural issues and experience with solution architecture
* Experience developing and working with LLMs (Large Language Models) and prompt engineering
* Fluent English, both spoken and written



  





 I
 **t’s a plus if you have** 



* Experience in fine-tuning LLMs
* Knowledge in Machine Learning and its applications
* Cloud experience, e.g., Azure, GCP, or AWS
* Experience working with Python orchestration tools
* Experience in Intelligent Automation, such as RPA (Robotic Process Automation), computer vision, and IDP (Intelligent Document Processing)
* Fluent in Swedish, both spoken and written



  





**Why Zimply?** 




 At Zimply you’ll have the opportunity to work with exciting technology and be part of an innovative team driven by a passion for automation and AI. You will join a dynamic work environment where you can grow alongside the company and dedicated colleagues, working together to create solutions that drive meaningful impact.
 



  





**We offer you:** 



* Competitive salary
* Wellness allowance of SEK 5,000 per year
* Pension and Private Health insurance
* Flexible working hours
* Possibility to be eligible for stock options
* Offices in central Stockholm or Gothenburg



  





 Are you ready to take the next step in your career and make a difference? Apply today and become a part of our team!
 



  





**Zimply is working together with Safemind as a recruitment partner managing this recruitment process.**

title: Mekatronikingenjör
description:
### **JOB DESCRIPTION**



Vi på Sigma Industry Evolution jobbar med att hjälpa några av de ledande teknikföretagen i flertalet branscher med att bemöta de utmaningar som de står inför. Nu söker vi mekatroniker för uppdrag inom bilindustrin.



Du är intresserad av att jobba i bilindustrin och har tidigare erfarenhet av testning på systemnivå.


### **BASIC QUALIFICATIONS**



Du har en högskole- eller civilingenjörsexamen inom maskinteknik/mekatronik/elektro.


* Du har god kunskap om elektromekaniska system.
* Viss programmeringsvana.
* Flytande i tal och skrift både på svenska och engelska.
* Erfarenhet av testning på systemnivå.
* Tidigare erfarenheter från bilindustrin är meriterande.

### **PREFERRED ADDITIONAL SKILLS, PERSONAL TRAITS AND EXPERIENCE**



Som person är du social och har ett stort intresse för teknik. Du är självgående, drivande och noggrann i ditt arbete. Som konsult på Sigma är det också viktigt att ha god förståelse för kundens önskemål samt teknikens möjligheter.



### **WE OFFER**



Vårt erbjuder en möjlighet att få vara med och bygga upp ett företag i framkant.


* En flexibel arbetsdag
* Högt individuellt förtroende
* En framåtblickande organisation
* Vi drivs av nya idéer och utveckling

title: PhD student position in Software Engineering for Regenerative Agriculture
description:
**Information about the division and the department**  

The Department of Computer Science and Engineering at Chalmers and University of Gothenburg in Sweden with approximately 270 employees from more than 30 countries is widely recognized for excellent research and education.



We are announcing one PhD position that is placed at the Division of Interaction Design and Software Engineering, with Chalmers University of Technology as the employer. Our division provides world-leading research and education in the development of complex and software-intense systems and is characterized by extensive international cooperation as well as close collaboration with the local industry. With approximately 50 researchers including PhD students, postdocs, and faculty on all levels, we are one of the largest academic software engineering research groups in the world. Our core expertise is in AI Engineering, software testing, requirements engineering, behavioral software engineering, and software engineering for automotive systems.



The project investigates the contributions software engineering can make to regenerative agriculture. We are seeking a passionate and driven PhD student to join our dynamic research team at Chalmers to explore the intrinsic value of nonhuman nature as a stakeholder. This position offers a unique opportunity to contribute to cutting-edge research at the intersection of software engineering, sustainability, and requirements engineering. The successful candidate will explore innovative ways to incorporate nature as a stakeholder into software development processes, with a particular focus on applications that support permaculture (permanent agriculture). The project contributes to sustainability and sustainable development with effects in reducing hunger and climate change, and improving sustainable communities and life on land.


**Main responsibilities**  

Your main responsibilities are to pursue your own doctoral studies. You are expected to develop your own scientific concepts and communicate the results of your research verbally and in writing. This includes devoting 80% of your working time to performing research under the supervision of more experienced researchers. Typically, this means carrying out research, writing academic articles, and taking courses to complement your background. The remaining 20% of your working time is devoted to departmental duties, such as helping as teaching assistant in courses offered by the university.



Read more about doctoral studies at Chalmers here.  

  

**Qualifications**  

A person meets the general entry requirements for third-cycle studies if they:


* have been awarded a second-cycle qualification
* satisfy the requirements for courses comprising at least 240 credits of which at least 60 credits were awarded in the second-cycle, or
* have acquired substantially equivalent knowledge in some other way in Sweden or abroad
* have a well-developed analytical problem-solving ability
* have demonstrated strong interest in regenerative agriculture


To succeed in the role, we believe you are:


* highly motivated and energetic
* self-propelled and independent
* empathetic and have high ethical standards
* able to work effectively and respectfully in a multi-cultural team


We strongly welcome candidates who have demonstrated early research potential in the area of this project, evidenced either through initial publication(s) or a strong master’s thesis. Prior industrial experience (e.g., as a software engineer) is a plus.



The assessment will be based on applicant’s CVs and interviews, and may also include a short take-home or live test, in which the applicants can demonstrate their ability to solve technical problems and reason about relevant research problems.



The position requires sound verbal and written communication skills in English. If Swedish is not your native language, Chalmers offers Swedish courses.  

  

**Contract terms**  

Full-time temporary employment. The position is limited to a maximum of five years.  

  

**What we offer**  

Chalmers provides a cultivating and inspiring working environment in the coastal city of Gothenburg.  

Read more about working at Chalmers and our benefits for employees.  

  

Chalmers aims to actively improve our gender balance. We work broadly with equality projects, for example the GENIE Initiative on gender equality for excellence. Equality and diversity are substantial foundations in all activities at Chalmers.  

  

**Application procedure**  

*The application should be written in English and be attached as PDF-files, as below. Maximum size for each file is 40 MB. Please note that the system does not support Zip files.*  

  

**CV:** *(Please name the document: CV, Family name)*  

* CV
* Other, for example previous employments or leadership qualifications and positions of trust.
* Two references that we can contact.

  

**Personal letter:** *(Please name the document as: Personal letter, Family name)*  

1-3 pages where you:  

* Introduce yourself
* Describe your previous experience of relevance for the position (e.g. education, thesis work and, if applicable, any other research activities)
* Describe your future goals and future research focus

  

**Other documents:**  

* Copies of bachelor and/or master’s thesis.
* Attested copies and transcripts of completed education, grades and other certificates, e.g. TOEFL test results.

  

Use the button at the foot of the page to reach the application form.
**Please note:** The applicant is responsible for ensuring that the application is complete. Incomplete applications and applications sent by email will not be considered.

  

**Application deadline: February 28, 2025**

  

**For questions:**  

Regarding the position, please contact Associate Professor Birgit Penzenstadler  

E-mail: birgitp@chalmers.se


*\*\*\* Chalmers declines to consider all offers of further announcement publishing or other types of support for the recruiting process in connection with this position.* \*\*\*

title: RAM Engineer
description:
At **Alstom**, we understand transport networks and what moves people.


From high-speed trains, metros, monorails, and trams to turnkey systems, services, infrastructure, signalling, and digital mobility, we offer our diverse customers the broadest portfolio in the industry. Every day, 80,000 colleagues lead the way to greener and smarter mobility worldwide, connecting cities as we reduce carbon and replace cars.

  


Alstom is the largest player in the Swedish railway market, with over 1,000 trains delivered and several large maintenance contracts, offering maintenance in 19 local depots. The company is also leading the ERTMS rollout in Sweden both onboard and trackside and delivering the new standard national traffic management system for Trafikverket.

  


*Are you ready to take your RAM expertise to the next level in a transformative and innovative industry?*

  


**Alstom** is looking for a


**RAM Engineer**


to be based in **Stockholm**

  


**Your Future Role:**


*Working with railway signalling has never been more exiting that now. The new European standard,* ***ERTMS*** *is on its way to reshape the future of public transportation.*

  


You will lead, coordinate, and perform all the **activities** from the **Tender phase** up to **Operational phase** to ensure that our solutions are reliable, maintainable and available. For this, you will identify the best architecture according to **RAM** performance requirements, customer’s needs and operational conditions. You will also guarantee a risk control for each requirement related to RAM and perform continuous reliability growth in projects and programs.

  


To **guarantee** the **optimal performance level of our systems**, you will be accountable for the main Reliability, Availability and Maintainability aspects over the lifecycle phases of the solutions.

  


You will report directly to the Nordics Regional RAM Department Head and as dotted line to the Manager of Projects and Programs to which you will be assigned and considered as the RAM reference.


Internally, you will interface with the RAM Community, the Project or Program Core teams, Safety, the Engineering Métiers (Hardware, System, Verification & Validation, etc.), Cybersecurity, Tenders, Sourcing, Installation, Test and Commissioning, and Warranty & Maintenance. You will also be in contact with customers, suppliers, and subcontractors.

  


**What You’ll Do:**


During Tender and Design phases, you will:


* Support Tender and Sourcing teams to choose and integrate the products and systems in the projects,
* Avoid non-compliance and minimize the penalties,
* Do Reliability Predictions (MTTF/MTBF),
* Assess Life expectation,
* Perform Failure Modes & Effects Analysis (FMEA),
* Analyse Degraded modes,
* Model Availability and calculate Service Reliability,
* Conduct Maintainability and Testability analysis.

  




During Operational phase, you will lead the following activities:


* Data collection from the field or customer and data collection from the repair sites,
* Root cause identification and RAM classification of the reported failures,
* Statistical analysis of collected data,
* Reliability growth analysis and actions plans proposal,
* Design recommendations based on RAM studies,
* Verification of the adequacy of architecture choices to the RAM targets.

  




**About You:**


At Alstom, we value passion, curiosity, and attitude as much as experience. Here’s what will help you thrive in this role:


* Advanced University or Engineering degree, ideally in Dependability (RAM/S),
* Scientific background in Statistics and Probabilities, together with good understanding of some System, Electrical, Electronics, Electromechanical, Telecom, Applied Mathematics or Software development techniques would be an advantage,
* Specific hands-on experience in RAM and mastering RAM methodology, concepts, methods and tools,
* Knowledgeable and experience of Railway Signalling or in other fields with high RAMS requirements (e.g., Aeronautics, Space, Defence, Automotive, Medical, Nuclear, Power, Civil Engineering, Machinery, Oil and Gas sectors),
* Structured, organized, rigorous,
* Team player and proactive behaviour,
* A flexible approach and the ability to work effectively against deadlines,
* Great problem identification and solving skills,
* Ability to drive activities performed by others (subcontractors, suppliers),
* Creativity and negotiation skills (tenders, failure reviews),
* Fully proficient English, Swedish is an added value.

  




**Things You’ll Enjoy**


Join us on a transformative journey – the rail industry is here to stay, offering you stability, growth opportunities, and meaningful challenges.

  


**You’ll also:**


* Enjoy a dynamic and rewarding long-term career.
* Collaborate with supportive colleagues and transverse teams.
* Contribute to innovative and impactful projects.
* Utilize our flexible working environment.
* Benefit from our investment in your development through award-winning learning.
* Receive a fair and dynamic reward package that recognizes your performance and potential.
* You don’t need to be a train enthusiast to thrive with us. We guarantee that when you step onto one of our trains with your friends or family, you’ll be proud. If you’re up for the challenge, we’d love to hear from you!

  




**Why Alstom?**


At Alstom, you’ll join a team committed to shaping the future of sustainable transport with innovation and purpose. Joining us means being part of a global community dedicated to excellence and creating a secure environment for our operations.


Are you ready to join a truly international community of great people on a challenging journey with a tangible impact and purpose?

  


**Important to Note**


As a global business, we’re an equal-opportunity employer that celebrates diversity across the 70+ countries we operate in. We are committed to creating an inclusive workplace for everyone.

  


**Apply now**

  


  

**Job Segment:** Testing, Risk Management, Telecom, Telecommunications, Technology, Finance
company_description: Leading societies to a low carbon future, Alstom develops and markets mobility solutions that provide the sustainable foundations for the future of transportation.

title: R&D Engineer – Electronics Component Engineer
description:
**Description**


**The opportunity**


Do you have a deep interest in technology and would like to join a multinational organization with lots of development opportunities? Join Hitachi Energy in Ludvika, Sweden, as a R&D Engineer with focus on Electronics Components and work in a team which is dedicated to creating a future where innovative digital technologies bring cleaner energy to more people. Take a leap in your career and seize this opportunity!


In this role you will be part of MACH Products, in Ludvika. The MACH Control & Protection Platform R&D department is a part of HVDC, Hitachi Energy and is responsible for the development of state-of-the-art control system platform for HVDC and FACTS applications. The MACH C&P department in Ludvika has around 70 employees, focusing mainly on Hardware and Software design working in close collaboration with the global MACH C&P organization.


The HVDC technology has been on the market for the past 60 years and is used, among other things, to transmit power over long distances with minimal losses, using overhead lines, underground and submarine cable systems.

 **How you´ll make an impact**

* You will be responsible for the electronics components within MACH products.
* You will work closely with product development teams specially electronics design engineers during development of new products as well as maintenance of existing products.
* You will communicate and interact with internal supply chain management and electronics manufacturing services regarding component related questions.
* You will interface with electronics component manufacturer to get component related information.
* Work in interaction with a PLM system to secure; correct technical component data, descriptions, attributes, correct environmental compliance data and up to date technical information such as data sheets, PDNs, PCNs.
* You will be living Hitachi Energy’s core values of safety and integrity, which means taking responsibility for your own actions while caring for your colleagues and the business.

**Your background**

* To succeed in this role, you have a deep understanding of electronics components from electronics development work and/or experience of working as component engineer in a supply chain or development organization. You have a university education preferably in electronics engineering/physics/materials science but relevant experience in component engineering tasks is the most important.
* Knowledge and continuous follow up of developments in electronics component industry is a must for this position.
* Experience in search and selection of components for new designs.
* Experience of advanced PLM tools and the ability to prepare well organized documentation and reports for components and LCM analysis.
* Ability to read and interpret circuit schematics and experience of electronics manufacturing and component sourcing processes.
* For this position spoken and written skills in English are mandatory and fluency in Swedish is highly desirable

**What we offer**

* Collective agreement
* Flexible working time
* Health care and wellness allowance
* Fantastic career possibilities within Hitachi Energy both within Sweden and globally
* Mentor to support you throughout onboard phase
* Various trainings and education supporting employee development
* Diversified company with over 70+ nationalities working in Sweden
* Supplementary compensation for parental leave
* Employee Benefit Portal with thousands of discounts and perks

**More about us**


Are you ready for a new exciting challenge? Does the above description sound like you? Last day to apply is 20.02.2025. Applications will be reviewed on an ongoing basis, so don’t delay – apply today.


Recruiting Manager Naman Raval, naman.raval@hitachienergy.com will be happy to answer your questions regarding this position.

title: Hedge Accountant for Large Projects
description:
**Description**


**The opportunity**


We are seeking a detail-oriented, experienced Hedge Accountant to support establishing and managing Hitachi Energy’s hedge accounting practices. You will ensure compliance with accounting standards and drive improvements to our hedge accounting processes. You will play a critical role in managing and reporting derivative transactions, ensuring accurate hedge effectiveness testing and maintaining alignment with IFRS 9 requirements. To help establish and implement a fit-for-purpose approach to hedge accounting, you will be collaborating with corporate controlling, the business, treasury and IT.

**How you’ll make an impact**

* Ensure accurate documentation of hedge relationships and assess hedge effectiveness
* Record and monitor hedging transactions in S4 HANA and ensure proper reporting in our consolidation tool
* Collaborate with the treasury team to evaluate financial risks related to foreign exchange for large, complex projects
* Prepare and present hedge accounting reports, disclosures, and reconciliations for financial statements
* Ensure compliance with relevant regulations, including IFRS 9 and Hitachi Energy reporting requirements
* Liaise with external auditors during audits and respond to inquiries
* Provide insights and recommendations to management and project controllers on improving hedging effectiveness
* Enhance hedge accounting processes and systems, with the support of IT, to improve efficiency and accuracy
* Work with project controllers on large, long duration and complex projects to effectively hedge risk exposure

**Your Background**

* Bachelor’s degree in accounting, Economics and/or Business Administration
* Minimum 5 years of experience in hedge accounting, financial risk management, and/or treasury functions
* Strong knowledge of financial derivatives and hedging strategies
* In-depth understanding of IFRS 9 or similar hedge accounting standards. In-depth knowledge of other IFRS standards is strongly preferred
* Proficiency in financial software (e.g., SAP or specialized hedge accounting tools)
* Strong analytical, problem-solving, and organizational skills
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to interact with stakeholders
* Fluency in written and spoken English (other languages are an advantage)

**What we offer**

title: Solution Test Engineer - Analytics & Platform Test
description:
Job Title
Solution Test Engineer - Analytics & Platform Test
Job Description*Are you driven by a desire to get hands-on with technology and see it in action? Do you like to work outdoors occasionally? We're looking for a skilled engineer who combines a passion for coding with a knack for testing in both controlled lab settings and real-world environments. If you're fascinated by the possibilities of computer vision and video analytics and enjoy writing code to automate tests and solve problems, we'd love to hear from you. Our team is part of a leading Quality Assurance organization, and we're excited to welcome a talented Solution Test Engineer to our ranks to our HQ in Lund, Sweden.*
Who is your future team?
Join our Analytics and Platform Test team, a collaborative and dynamic group focused on delivering high-quality video analytics solutions.  

Our team is all about autonomy, creativity, and collaboration. We trust each other to take ownership of our work and make decisions that drive results. With a strong sense of responsibility comes great freedom – and we love that. But it's not all serious business; we believe having fun together is just as important as getting the job done. If you're looking for a team that's self-sufficient, innovative, and enjoys each other's company, you might just fit right in.  

As a Solution Test Engineer, you'll join a small team of three, working closely with your colleagues to verify our video analytics software. You'll also collaborate with development teams, other QA engineers and project managers to ensure seamless performance in real-world scenarios.
What will you do as a Solution Test Engineer?
Your primary focus as a Solution Test Engineer will be on ensuring the seamless integration and performance of video analytics applications on network connected camera hardware products, from an end-to-end perspective. Your responsibilities will include:* Design and deploy comprehensive test systems in both field and lab environments, occasionally requiring outdoor testing to simulate real-world conditions.
* Plan, execute, and manage test activities to ensure thorough coverage, often involving hands-on testing in realistic environments.
* Analyze test data, logs, and results to identify trends and insights.
* Present test findings clearly and concisely to diverse stakeholders.
* Develop and maintain automated testing scripts and tools using programming/scripting languages such as Python (preferred), as well as other languages like C# or similar, to streamline end-to-end testing processes and increase efficiency.

Who are we looking for?
We're looking for a motivated and adaptable individual to join our team. You may have a background in test automation, scripting, or coding, and are now eager to expand your skillset and take on new challenges. Perhaps you've found yourself wanting more variety in your current role or seeking opportunities to apply your technical expertise in a more dynamic and hands-on environment. This role is perfect for self-starters who thrive on independence, drive their own projects, and crave the freedom to make decisions. However, you're also a team player who believes that collaborative efforts lead to better outcomes, and you enjoy sharing knowledge, ideas, and successes with your colleagues. If this sounds like you, we offer a culture that encourages autonomy, creativity, and growth.
Who is your future manager?
As your manager, I believe in empowering you to take ownership of your work, with the freedom to make choices and decisions responsibly. I lead through coaching, fostering a collaborative and informal team dynamic where everyone feels heard. At its core, leadership is about more than just managing others - it's about taking initiative and driving change. In fact, I think leadership is in everyone - stepping up, showing the courage to act, and inspiring others to do the same. For me, the greatest reward is seeing our team flourish and knowing that I've played a part in helping each of you reach your full potential. And let's not forget - all of this happens with a healthy dose of humor and a commitment to having fun along the way!  

What Axis have to offer
One of our greatest assets is our focus on collaboration. We also know that good ideas can come anytime and anywhere and therefore we encourage everyone to contribute and be innovative. If you are a person who likes to make a difference, you will feel right at home with us!
The well-being of the employees is essential to us. We work actively with our culture where team spirit, equal opportunities for all and having fun are central parts. We want you to enjoy working with us! Therefore, we offer great benefits, e.g., flexible working hours, breakfast every day, classic Swedish fika on Fridays, corporate bonus, physical training grants, insurances, your very own Axis bicycle – just to name a few.  

Ready to Act?
Do you want to join our team? Apply today, we evaluate applications continuously. If you have any questions, you are welcome to reach out to hiring manager Carl Wiberg carl\_wiberg@axis.com
Type of Employment
Permanent Employment
Posting End Date
2025-02-18*Certain roles at Axis require background checks, which means applicable verifications will be done in these recruitments.* *Notice will be provided before we take any action.*
About Axis Communications
We enable a smarter, safer world by creating innovative solutions for improving security and business performance. As a network technology company and industry leader, we offer solutions in video surveillance, access control, intercom, and audio systems, enhanced by intelligent analytics applications.
With around 4500 committed employees in over 50 countries, we collaborate with partners worldwide. Together, we thrive in our friendly, open, and collaborative culture and inspire each other to think beyond the expected. United by our commitment to inclusion, diversity, and sustainability, we consistently seek to develop our skills and way of working.
Let´s create a smarter, safer world
For more information about Axis, please visit our website www.axis.com.

title: Antenna Engineer
description:
### **JOB DESCRIPTION**



We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Antenna Engineer to design, develop, and test antenna systems and subsystems.



As an Antenna Engineer, you’ll be tasked with developing concepts for new antenna system designs and improving existing ones.



Your responsibilities will include developing and optimizing antenna designs for wireless communication systems, performing simulations to validate antenna designs, and working collaboratively with cross-functional teams to integrate antennas into final product designs.



Our ideal candidate is comfortable with the entire development process, from initial concept to final testing and implementation.



Responsibilities


* Designing and testing antenna systems and subsystems
* Developing and optimizing antenna designs for wireless communication systems
* Performing simulations to validate antenna designs
* Working collaboratively with cross-functional teams to integrate antennas into final product designs
* Creating specifications for antenna components
* Documenting all design processes and test results
* Adhering to industry standards and company procedures
* Staying up to date with the latest trends and developments in antenna engineering

### **BASIC QUALIFICATIONS**


* Proven experience as an antenna engineer
* In-depth knowledge of antenna design and simulation tools
* Experience with RF circuit design
* Excellent problem-solving abilities
* Strong understanding of electromagnetic theory and antenna physics
* Good communication and team collaboration skills
* Ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines
* BSc degree in Electrical Engineering or a related field, MSc or Ph.D. preferred

### **PREFERRED ADDITIONAL SKILLS, PERSONAL TRAITS AND EXPERIENCE**



As a person, you are social and have a great interest in technology. You are self-motivated, driven and meticulous in your work. As a consultant at Sigma, it is also important to have a good understanding of the customer's wishes and the possibilities of the technology.

* A flexible working day
